You smile as you leave Sarah to the ordering and start laying the table in the smaller dinning room. As you place the plates and cutlery you keep stopping and staring through the window wall, watching the sea going up to the horizon and the evening sun giving the beach a lazy and relaxed feel. It occurs to you that you have no idea where you are since you changed reality. Obviously you are somewhere hot and on the coast but aside from that there is no clue. Florida maybe, perhaps even Hawaii. It matters little to you right now. As far as you are concerned its paradise.

"I never get tired of that view." You jump from your trance and spin to see Sarah standing behind you holding two pizza boxes. You must have zoned out longer than you thought. That or the delivery service was excellent. She places one of the boxes in your spot and then sits with her own. You join her and open up the box to put a few slices on the plate. When you open it, your nose is assaulted by the most perfectly delicious pizza smell you have ever experienced. Immediately your mouth starts to water. You grab a slice of it and scarf it down almost without chewing at the same time rewarding your taste buds with the one of the greatest flavour journeys they have ever been on. Sarah smirks at you as she watches you wolf down another slice. "Wow, I didn't know cravings started that fast" You give her an embarrassed smile.

"I'm sorry, this pizza is just so delicious" you say between bites.

"I should hope so for what they're charging" Sarah says taking a bite of her own. "So I know you get the final choice to name our daughter but what do you think about the name Sofía?" She watches you expectantly.

"Sofía?" you repeat thinking about it.

"Yeah, Sofía Bennet, sounds pretty good right?"

You agree that it does seem a pretty name but you remember that you will also need two more. "I like it" you pause for a moment, "But maybe we should make a list first, I get a feeling we may need it." you say with a grin.
11113211122222121212211212122111.title: You learn that this is actually very common now...

choices: You try to make further changes to reality, to stabilize society.
You try, but RealityShift.net appears to be down...?
You don't bother trying to fix anything, continue with your pregnancy.
111132111222221212122112121221111.content:
"Pleased to meet you, Miss Bennet, my name is Charles Montague, and I can't wait to get started on our business collaboration. I can see great things in our future." A portly middle-aged man said to your wife, shaking her hand and looking very excited about this deal.

You were standing by her side, wearing an incredibly expensive dress, which was designed to show off your Latina curves. But one curve, in particular, the baby bump pressing your belly outwards, was emphasized most of all. You wanted everyone to know that you were expecting.

Sarah smiled at the man but then turned to you, "I'm sure there are great things in our future Mr. Montague, but the greatest thing in my future is right here. I'd like you to meet my wife, Maria."

You gave a slight nod of the head out of politeness but made sure to look dignified and not make this man feel like he was superior to you. You smiled brightly and held out your hand for him to shake. He took it hesitantly and gave your body several glance-overs before releasing it.

"Hm, and pleased to meet you as well... Miss Bennet?" He then turned back towards Sarah, "I was under the impression you were married to a man?" Charles asked her as though you weren't even in the room.

A younger woman stood by Charles' side and looked disapproving at his attitude. You assumed this was the man's wife. Every wealthy businessman brought their trophy wives to these gala events, but she had an intelligent look about her. Not just some airhead gold digger that was clinging to a rich man, but someone who aimed to make something of herself, without his help. She looked into your eyes apologetically, as though regretting the way her husband was talking about you. You found yourself sighing and with a quick smile to her, you already felt a bond formed.

Meanwhile, Sarah cleared her throat and looked at you. "Maria was a man once, many years ago, but she's going to be the mother of my children, and she's as much female as any woman in this room. She is not only my wife, but my business partner, and wherever I go, she goes. If that makes you uncomfortable, then I have a dozen other investors lined up and ready to jump in.

Charles looked to be speechless momentarily until his wife stepped in to save him. "Sorry my husband didn't introduce me, my name's Astrid, pleased to meet you both. You're going to be a mother I see! You look lovely, dear. You must be very far along?"

"Actually, I'm at 18 weeks currently," You said, with a glowing smile and patted your protruding belly. "But triplets grow three times as fast as one baby. Makes me look farther along than I am. Still, quite a ways to go!"

"Triplets?! My god, that's incredible! And with that dress you look absolutely radiant, really shows off your lovely belly!" Astrid complimented you, earning herself a glare from her husband.

Charles remained silent through all the female bonding until he decided it had gone on far enough. "Yes, well, Miss and Miss Bennet, I... I hope we can continue to work together, I really believe we can do great things."

After a brief exchange of handshakes and a quick hug from Astrid, the couples parted ways, and you glanced back to your wife who looked pleased.

"Men like him are still holding on to the old guard way of the world. He clearly doesn't like how so many women are becoming successful, but he hides it well most of the time." Sarah took a sip of juice from the glass in her hand. She'd sworn off alcohol during your pregnancy since it wouldn't be fair that you couldn't have any and she could.

You sighed in response, "Yeah... and he clearly isn't a fan of men taking the plunge into becoming women either. Did you see the look on his face when he realized the pregnant lady used to be a man? I can't blame him... People like me are responsible for what'll eventually be the extinction of the male gender, at this rate."

It was truer than you would admit to Sarah. It wasn't just people like you; it WAS you who was responsible. Your change to reality had set this chain of events in motion. With men able to become women capable of reproduction, and two women giving birth to only girls, men were in danger of disappearing entirely in the next few decades. It had been 18 weeks since you changed reality, and in all your observations, you were growing concerned that this reality was simply not sustainable in the long run. But your wife seemed to disagree.

"Don't worry about it sweetie, I support you, and so many others do as well! I know it hurts when people like him spout their prejudices, but society is going to move past this, and our children will have the best mother they could ask for. No one is going to think twice about girls with two mothers by the time they're old enough to realize what that means." Sarah tried to comfort you, placing her hand around your waist, pulling you closer to her for a quick peck on the lips.

You weren't sure her comforting words helped at all. In the end, this was still undeniably your doing. Even though you liked this reality with Sarah with every fiber of your being, the intellectual side of you still knew that messing with something on such a scale as this was not going to end well. Perhaps you could still do something to fix this.
111132111222221212122112121221111.title: Into the pregnancy.

choices: Change things so you were only ever a dancer and model.
1111321112222212121221121212211113.content:
You have a long hard think about making a change over the next few days but eventually you decide it would be side not to make a change unless you truly have to so aside from a few cheeky cosmetic changes you make to yourself to appear younger you leave realityshift.net untouched for the next few weeks. You try to ignore the news reports and documentaries that all warn of the gradual decline of males in society and instead busy yourself with wife duties, accompanying Sarah on her business meetings. You are surprised by the amount of men in ceo positions you meet on these trips considering the state of the world however all of them seem to share similar attitudes to Mr. Montague when you are introduced to them. As your pregnancy continues, by 29 weeks you have ballooned massively and find even walking, or waddling in your case, to be extremely tiring so you take a more supportive and secretarial role for Sarah when at work and with clients. You also start feeling the babies moving inside of you, kicking and such and this brings tears to your eyes every time this happens.

When you are not working, you spend your time enjoying your beautiful beach front home and going to dinner with your neighbors. As it turns out Helen and Gabriela were trying for a baby around the same time as you and the once lithe and svelte, Latina Gabriela now sports a huge baby bulge reviling yours since she is only two weeks behind you. You all laugh and joke together but also discuss the future of your children and how nice it would be if all your girls could be friends growing up. Helen also reveals on one such night out that Gabriela will be leaving her job to be a full time, stay-at-home mom since they don't want their children raised by strangers or child careers. This had been a concern for you and Sarah as you both worked high flying jobs and even the one you worked at home would not give you enough time to look after three baby girls. One night a few days after your dinner with the neighbors, Sarah proposes that you consider doing the same as Gabriela and be a housewife, while she remains the breadwinner. You are taken aback by this as to had always assumed you would work something out or take turns as carers.

The point she makes is that, while you are a successful business woman, she is even more so, earning more and having more contacts. She suggested you sign over your company to her so you could focus on caring for the kids. "Think of it as a promotion" she said. "You get the joy of raising our girls, what better job can there be?" You know that it is the most logical and practical choice to make but you can't help but feel as though it's step down and you're some how the lesser partner in the relationship since you will support while Sarah provides so you tell Sarah you will think about it.

The next day, you go and visit Gabriela in her's and Helen's beautiful home just up the beach. Since she is going to be housewife and seemed content about it, you wanted her advice. Since Gabriela was now here near as smart or as successful having once been a waitress in a Brazilian hotel where she met Helen, she had never brought much money to the relationship so was happy to be provided for by Helen's career as a world class lawyer. You explained to her you problem that you were the equal partner and brought almost as much money as Sarah into the home and by giving that up you felt somehow weaker. Gabriela explains that that feeling is natural and something that you should learn to embrace as you know you have a wife who loves you enough to support and protect you. You still aren't convinced but you can't deny you know this is the best thing for your family so you thank Gabriela for the talk and head home.

As you trudge along the beach, you can't help but wonder if you hadn't been the financial success you are, maybe you wouldn't be feeling like this, maybe if you had only been a model and dancer, you would have less qualms about being provided for. You also remember that when you were a man, the main reason you became a woman was to get more money to support Sarah, so maybe of that past personality is rearing its head.

When you get home after a long waddle down the beach, you sit at your computer and bring up reality shift.net. You are really considering changing things so you were never the financial success you were as then you could enjoy being a housewife like Gabriela. You know that you will end up in this position regardless as its best for all concerned and all other options you can think of would require hiring a caregiver which neither you or Sarah want.

In the end you...
1111321112222212121221121212211113.title: You don't bother trying to fix anything, co...

choices: You become a maternity model, as the due date grows ever closer.
Sarah begins looking younger as well, over the next few weeks.
Skip straight to the due date!
11113211122222121212211212122111132.content:
After thinking it over a long while, you just couldn't bring yourself to undo all of your past achievements. You were aware that in truth you had never been responsible for any of these achievements since they were all part of your new rewritten history, but they felt as real to you as the babies in your belly right now. You had strong memories of rising through the ranks of your company, only to go independent and partner up with your wife in your own business venture. These memories were a part of you now, and giving them up would just be making yourself blissfully ignorant.

In addition to those memories, you remembered as a hobby you'd dabbled in modeling as Maria. You were never a famous supermodel, but it was something you enjoyed and helped pay the bills while you were still building your life up to where you are now. Just the thought of it made you smile, and you realized that it had indeed become one of your passions in life. But once you started becoming a successful businesswoman, you no longer had time for photo shoots and socializing with the entertainment nightlife. But this could change.

When you caught a glimpse of your reflection in the computer screen, you were reminded of the changes you made to yourself the other day. You were a woman in your 30's, but you looked barely a day over 19. You'd gotten a bit vain and started tweaking your appearance out of curiosity, and nearly forgot about it until now. You looked younger than you were when you first became Maria, by several years. And you'd even gone ahead and given your bust a slight boost as well, and cleaned up some imperfections in your facial features. With these renewed looks you could jump back into modeling after all, and still have time for raising the kids.

"But if I'm going to do this, I'm going to do it on my own terms. It'll be interesting to do photoshoots with a belly this size, but there's always a need for maternity models!" You said to yourself, with a smirk in the reflection.

Later that day you let your wife know that you were retiring from work, like she suggested. You agreed that you could no longer keep up with this work while you were carrying triplets, and it would only get worse when they were born. She seemed glad to hear it.

"I was worried you'd try working yourself to death sweetie... It's good to know you're going to dedicate your time to the kids." Sarah told you with a quick kiss.

"That's not all though..." You said, avoiding eye contact with her. "Sarah I want to get back into modeling. When I have time, of course! The kids come first for sure, but you know this is a passion of mine that I've avoided for so long!"

You couldn't read her reaction, as she offered a mix of emotions. You weren't sure if she would be angry or encouraging. "Maria... what? You don't have enough time to work but you have time to model? I thought you retired years ago anyways?"

"I told you, it's only going to be when I have time! And right now... well I have time while I wait for these kids to come out. I have a unique opportunity to be a maternity model, and I want to take it! I need to do something to pass the time while I'm out of work. I can only tan out by the pool so much before I burn!" You point out.

She doesn't seem convinced and looks at you in concern. "Is this... is this about reliving the youth you never had? I know you've been really taking care of your looks lately, and you look younger than ever, but is this really what you want?"

"Sarah, I became Maria after my prime years already passed me by! I never got to experience being a young woman, it's true. People treat me different now that I look like I could be 19, and I have photography agencies lining up to give me offers! It's not even about the money, or I would just stay with my current job. This is about me expressing myself." You attempted to explain to your wife.

Finally, she nodded and cracked a smile while placing her hand on your shoulder. "It's your body, my love, and I certainly can't complain that they've been able to make you look so youthful and somehow prettier than before. I've been considered taking the youth treatment myself, or else people might think I'm robbing the cradle! But I see this means a lot to you, and I really can't blame you for wanting to pursue your hobbies. Just don't let this interfere with the children, ok?"

"Of course! The children are my whole life! This is just something to pass the time with!" Then, with all your might, you embraced Sarah with a thankful kiss. As your lips locked, your very round belly bumped against her, causing you both to burst into laughter.
11113211122222121212211212122111132.title: Leave things alone for now.

111132111222221212122112121221111321.content:
"That's it darling hold that pose." You obey the command and remain still.

http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2015/04/1...

Its a few weeks later and you are on the set of yet another photo shoot and once again you are being absolutely fabulous. The camera flashes slightly blinding you but you are used to it by now.

"Okay darling thats enough for today." comes the voice of Tracy the photographer. "I've got all the shots I need and let me just say that you're the best model I've had the pleasure of working with. These pictures will be on the cover"

"Thanks Tracy" You say massaging your now heavily swollen stomach. "I think this might be the last one for a while though. My due date is nearly here."

"Not to worry darling, there's no rush. Spend time with your family, relax get a puppy I don't care." she says with a grin as she packs up her camera. "Whenever you're ready I'm ready."

"Thanks for being so understanding Tracy. I'll call you when I'm ready to model for you again." you say heading towards the exit of the villa you were using as the location of the shoot.

"Of course, anytime darling," Tracy says waving her hands dismissively now looking at the pictures on her laptop.

You leave the villa and climb into your obscenely expensive car and set off home.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------

The day after you announced your return to modeling to Sarah, you got in contact with your old agencies who straight away found you steady work with an extremely popular international fashion magazine. While the magazine was intended for fashion purposes and the pictures you took in it were never nudes and always tasteful, it was no secret that teenage girls would use the pictures in them to please themselves sexually. Three days after the pictures of your first shoot were printed, you received a lot of love letters in the post and by email from girls between 14 and 22 all wanting you to be there wife or girlfriend. Most were innocent enough and were very flattering but as always with these things, some weirdos take it too far. It was on a Wednesday evening when you were taking out the garbage when you saw a figure in the bushes watching you. You immediately ran back inside and had Sarah check it out. Sarah returned dragging a girl from the local college by the collar who apparently had wanted to get pictures of you in the pool. Aside from a few more creepy letters, you haven't had any problems with fans. While at first unsure, Sarah loves the idea that she is married to a super model and has expressed her appreciation rather frequently in the bedroom. Overall it would seem that things are going well for you and with your due date now in less than a week, its a very exciting time.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------

You park up on your drive and enter your house. Since it is now late evening, you find Sarah lounging on a couch in the living room.

"Hey Maria. How was the shoot?" she asks putting down her book.

"Great Sar and I did what I promised. Now more modeling till after the girls are born and everything has settled down.

She stands and embraces you being careful of your stomach. "Thank you it means a lot to me" she says when she has released you. "I want you to be relaxed on these last few days so I got time off work so we can spend it together."

You smile knowing that the next few days would be spent being cuddled by Sarah by the pool. "I can't wait" you say smiling. Your smile turns to a frown as you feel liquid quickly running down your legs. "Ugh, what the?" you say looking down to see you are now standing in a pool of water. Sarah stops dead and an expression of shock and panic appears on her face.

"Your water's broke" she says almost in a whisper. "YOUR WATER HAS BROKE!!" she repeats at the top of her voice this time now hoping from one foot to the other like a maniac. Its at this you feel a great painful pressure down bellow. You grab onto Sarah's arm.

"The babies are coming" you say.

Sarah composes herself and wastes no more time by leading you panting and groaning to the car. When she fastens you in she starts the engine and her car leaps down the drive and onto the road. "Don't worry Maria. Just breathe." she says reassuringly.
111132111222221212122112121221111321.title: You become a maternity model, as the due date g...

choices: Sarah loves the names, and you are given time to rest and recover.
Sarah has a better idea for one of the names.
1111321112222212121221121212211113211.content:
Your whole trip to the hospital was a blur, with your mind racing in fear and anxiety. You knew the doctors would take care of you, but you weren't thinking rationally anymore. The pain and pressure around your abdomen was driving you mad. You barely even remembered being placed on the gurney and wheeled into the maternity ward. You waited in the hospital room with Sarah by your side, keeping you company, and clutching your hand the whole time.

"I can't believe this is happening…" You muttered, for what seemed like the hundredth time today.

Sarah just nodded, "I know sweetie, I know. It's hard to believe the time's finally here! We finally get to see our lovely daughters!"

"No I mean…" You shook your head weakly, "All of this. I know it's been months… well… years I guess. I used to be male, once upon a time, isn't it funny to think back?"

Your wife frowned slightly, looking very concerned, "I know, but you aren't anymore… You're Maria and you're about to be a mother. Are you having doubts all of a sudden?""I don't know, not really. I mean, yes I'm absolutely Maria, and I want to be a mother with all my soul… But part of me wonders if I would have wanted this before I changed." You began to muse out loud.

"Perhaps, but you were a different person back then. The male you from the past didn't have years of life experience living as a woman. And even then, it's a little too late for regrets now honey. This is all happening whether you want it or not!" She said with a smile.

"Of course, I -" You stopped mid-sentence as a contraction hit you hard. The rest of your sentence was just moaning and screaming.

The nurse quickly came in and administered a drug to you, which made your mind begin to haze. The painful contractions became less bothersome, and your mind began to wander. You saw memories of your life before reality changed, and they blurred together with this new reality where you had become Maria nearly 6 years ago. You hadn't been transgendered, you never identified as a woman. But the transformation changed all that. Sarah was right in that you were a different person now. You had your old memories, but your mind had been changed just as much as your body.

You came to accept that as Maria you had different wants and desires that your old male self never had. He would have never wanted to bear children, he would probably have thought it was strange to even have such thoughts. You weren't upset about it, because ultimately this reality was your own fault. You created this reality, but you were enjoying your new life so much, that any regrets were quickly fading into obscurity.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------

That was when the contractions hit you full blast and you realized you had been daydreaming under the effects of drugs for several hours. The doctor was standing over you and it was finally happening. The nurse's voice echoed in your mind, telling you to push, push, push. The pressure built and built, and you screamed numbly as it reached unbearable levels. As it peaked, you were given a brief moment of relief, when you heard your first daughter crying.

You were crying yourself, as you caught a glimpse of the lovely tan little baby, being handled by the doctor. You barely had time to touch her tiny little hand when the pressure hit you once again.

"Aghhh… right… there's still more…" You mumbled through the screams.

The nurse took your daughter safely away, as you began to push once more. The pain was incredible, but somewhat less intense than before. A short time later, your second daughter's cries filled the room, and you saw a slightly lighter tan skinned baby girl with an even louder cry than the first. You couldn't make out any other details through your tears, but you could tell that she was healthy and safe.

Not long after, you began pushing once again, desperate to be done with it. The last baby was somehow stubborn and harder to get out than the first two. She was oriented the wrong way and it took some time for the doctor to finally coax her safely out. At last, the pressure began to subside, as your third daughter was brought into the world kicking and screaming. You could tell she was much paler than the first two, and her hair might even be blonde like Sarah's. It was hard to tell at this point, so you just laid back in relief, as your body began the recovery process.

"Congratulations Mrs. Bennet, three lovely, healthy girls. The most impressive birth I've ever seen from a former male, absolutely stunning!" The lady doctor congratulated you, beaming with delight as your three babies were brought over to see you.

Your wife held your first daughter in her arms, leaning over you to offer a better look. You weakly placed your hand on the baby's forehead, and smiled at the warmth you could feel. "She's a real live beautiful baby, that's for sure."

"Sofía… we should call her Sofía." Sarah said with a wink.

You smiled in return, "Yes, I agree, she looks like a Sofía. Can I see the others?"

The other two girls were held before you, and you reached out to caress each one's head. The second daughter was slightly less tan than Sofía, but still reflected much of your body's South American heritage.

"I… I always liked the name Alexandra… Alexa." You said, giving your second daughter a loving kiss on the forehead.

Then the odd ball of the bunch… the third baby was quite pale and wouldn't sit still, she was a feisty little one. Even with her mother's touch, she wouldn't quit crying.

"She's quite loud, like your mother Eleanor." You winked at Sarah, who simply held her mouth open in shock. You continued, "How about we call you Elena… Or Ellie for short."
1111321112222212121221121212211113211.title: Giving birth.

11113211122222121212211212122111132111.content:
"Yeah Ellie and Alexa, I like it" Sarah says taking your daughters back. "Oh and that reminds me, I better call my mom to tell her she is a grandparent. Will you be okay if I leave you for a moment baby? They don't like phones in here."

You nod weakly and give her a small smile. "Go ahead" you say. Your eyelids grow extremely heavy from the exhaustion of giving birth and from the drugs that you have been given so as Sarah leaves the room and hands your daughters back to the midwives you fall asleep.

You awake the next morning from a dreamless and refreshing sleep and find Sarah sat at your bedside beaming at you.

"Wakey wakes sleeping beauty." She says leaning over and giving you a kiss on the cheek.

You look around and don't see your daughters anywhere and a feeling of panic fills you that you have never felt before. "Where are the girls?" You say leaning up in bed.

"Shh relax Maria" Sarah says soothingly. "They're just under observation its standard. They are all remarkably healthy I'm told and you can see them when you're ready."

You slump back in bed, still tired and discover you have been changed out of your clothes into a gown. You look up into the eyes of your wife and smile. "I can't believe it. I'm a mother we're parents." You say, tears welling up.

"I know. All those late night nappy changes, and feedings, school, Christmases, birthdays, sleepovers, puberty" she pauses and shudders a little. "Dating" she says coldly. "Yeah we've got one wild ride ahead of us. But I know we can do it because you are going to be the best mommy on the planet." She takes your hand and kisses in gently.

"Mommy" you say. "I can't wait to hear them say it." You stop for a moment as a thought comes to you. "So what will they call you? Obviously I'm mommy but do you want to be too?"

Sarah looks thoughtful for a moment before replying. "I guess we could do what most couples like us do now and call me daddy. Having two moms will be confusing when they call for one us so yeah, just call me daddy." She says grinning.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------

You and Sarah talk for some time before you feel strong enough to move around. When you get out of bed you discover, much to the astonishment of the nurses and Sarah that your body has returned to that of a 19 year old woman, curvy with a flat stomach. Your breasts are still swollen however but your vagina shows no indication of having let three baby girls through. You try to act as surprised as them remembering your sneaky use of the website to prevent lasting damage to your body.

Sarah leads you to ward where newborns are kept and shows you to your daughters' cots. You again begin gushing with joy as you feel the great love only a mother can have as you look down upon them. You find Sofía and Alexa sleeping peacefully while Ellie is wide awake and looking around with curiosity. Her eyes meet yours and you even though she is a day old, you can tell there is some understanding there. You pick her up and hold her little body in your arms and cradle her. "You know who I am?" You ask. "I'm your mommy." Ellie looks up at you and reaches up at you with her little hand. You spend a few moments like this before you put her back and look over the other two who are still fast asleep.

"They're beautiful" you say finally. "And they've all got your eyes". It's true as each of your daughters, even Sofía and Alexa, despite reflecting more of their Latina heritage than their sister have piercing blue eyes.

"I bet they all grow to be stunners like you though." Sarah says patting you.

"I bet they do" you agree, thinking again about the website and the new options you have to help you have to ensure your daughters have the best futures possible.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------


You are kept in hospital for the next two days to ensure that both you and your girl's are healthy. You would have liked to have left sooner but Sarah wouldn't hear of it and made sure you got your rest. She rarely left your side and kept you company through the tedium of recuperation but you got to spend a lot of time with your daughters so that helped.

On your last full day in hospital, when Sarah had gone for some lunch, a nurse who came into your room to check your results recognised you from the magazines you have moddeled for and told you that her 16 year old daughter was a huge fan, had her room covered in posters of you and most likely has a bit of crush on you. You were a little embarrassed by this admission but took in your stride and took a selfie with the nurse and wrote an autographed personal message to the daughter. After many thanks, the nurse left. You later told Sarah of what happened and she just laughed. "You better not think about replacing me with a younger model" she joked.



---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------------

You are now standing outside your home with Sophía in your right arm and Alexa in your left wearing a light summer dress and a pair of ballet flats that feels so much better than your hospital gown and slippers, waiting for Sarah to open the door. She struggles slightly as she is holding Ellie at the same time but she soon has it open and you both head in.

"So who's in what room?" Sarah says retrieving her keys from Ellie's surprisingly strong grip.

Since you knew you were going to have triplets, you decorated three of your spare rooms that were next to each other and filled them with a crib, stuffed animals and other things expected in a child's room. You had painted them all different colours though. One pastely pink with hearts and stars dotting the walls, another green and the last one blue.

"Well I think Ellie here is boistress enough for the blue room" Sarah says as she again removes the keys from the newborn's grasp. "I'd say put Alexa in the green middle room since she has already proved herself a good buffer between Ellie and Sophía and the squabbling will only get worse as they get older."

You know that this is the right choice and nod your agreement. In the hospital, Ellie, when left lying next to Sophía would keep poking and prodding her which would result in Sophía crying. You found that when you placed Alexa in between them when lying them down, Ellie would be calmer. Already their personalities were developing.

"Alright, Sophía gets the pink then." You say as you enter the Alexa's new room. You place her in her crib and kiss her forehead before carrying Sophía into the pink room and laying her down to. Head downstairs and fall heavily into a couch and sigh. Sarah comes down and sits next to you.

"And so it begins" she says wrapping an arm around you. "Enjoy this rest now because there most likely won't be time for it anytime soon."

As if on cue, you hear crying from upstairs as all three triplets begin wailing.

"You just to open your mouth didn't you." You say grinning as you both stand.
11113211122222121212211212122111132111.title: Sarah loves the names, and you are given time t...

choices: Shift reality to make taking care of them easier, without hiring anyone.
Give in and hire a nice lady who can help you raise your girls.
You can do this without help, but you want to shift reality in some other way.
111132111222221212122112121221111321111.content:
Your new full-time job had just begun. Being a mother to three newborns was not something you thought would be easy, but even with Sarah's help, the first few weeks were a struggle, to say the least. You typically let them sleep in their separate rooms since you had the real estate to afford it, but that meant running around the house, checking on each girl individually all day long. When they weren't sleeping, you made sure to keep them all together in the same room, and took turns cradling each of them in your arms.

After the first week, you'd already run out of diapers and baby food. You quickly learned to start breastfeeding as soon as possible and found that your breasts were more than capable of providing ample milk even for all three girls. While they slept, you pumped extra milk into bottles, with extra left over by the end of the day. By the end of the second week, you no longer had to buy baby food at all! Sarah however, found it relaxing to come home at the end of the day and give you a break. She'd begun lactating as well, and when she had time, would help out with her own milk. The girls were mostly used to your milk, however, and seemed to prefer your attention over Sarah's. The exception turned out to be Alexa, who grew to prefer Sarah's milk instead. Neither of you could figure out why, but each girl had their own personality, and these things were bound to happen.

Diapers, on the other hand, were not something you could grow naturally. You were going through them faster than you could buy, and you were tempted to start having them shipped in by the pallet load. Sarah talked you out of it, however, saying there must be a way to do it in a cleaner way. Bulk amounts of disposable diapers polluted landfills and were such a waste of resources. She insisted there must be a way to reuse diapers, but most of the ones out there just didn't seem good enough. Finally, you turned to your old friend, the realityshift.net website. It was still running after all this time and was more than happy to shift reality once again. A short while later, you'd made perfectly reusable diapers a real product that was easy sanitary, and fast to clean. It made your life with the triplets so much easier, and you silently thanked Sarah for giving you the idea.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------

"It's a good thing they can't walk yet… or we'd really have our hands full trying to keep them from getting into things." Sarah told you with an exhausted sigh. "I'm going to need to start spending more time at work soon, are you sure you're going to be ok with all three of them?"

"I think I can manage… it's my job now, you know? So many teen girls are going to be sad to learn that I have no more time for modeling." You told your wife with a wink.

"I'm serious! This is going to be tough for you; it would be tough for any mom! But we can definitely afford to hire help if you think you need it. We've got a spare room, and someone could stay here to raise the kids with you. It's not unheard of, plenty of moms get help like this if they can afford it!"

"I know, I know, but… I don't know. I am pretty confident that I'll be able to take care of things. If it gets too much for me, then I'll reconsider. But for now, just focus on work, and don't worry about me! The company needs your guidance after all. I really love taking care of the girls, so it's not like I'm being forced to be a mommy." You reassured her with a kiss, which caused Ellie to start crying in your arms. You and Sarah both laughed at the timing and went back to tending to their needs.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------

More weeks went by, and soon the girls were four months old and beginning to make bubbly baby sounds that almost sounded like words. You were still actively breastfeeding, which had bumped you up a few cup sizes from all the swelling. You took this as a blessing but knew you couldn't keep doing it for many more months. Alexa was even more picky, almost insisting on 'daddy's milk instead of yours, as though she could taste the difference. Sofia and Ellie never wanted to feed at the same time, and would get fussy if they did. They both got along well with Alexa but preferred your milk instead.

Keeping up with all of their growing needs and diverging personalities was starting to take its toll. If you hadn't altered reality to keep your body in youthful tip top shape, you'd certainly be putting on weight. You had no time for swimming, or any other exercise, other than running around the house keeping track of babies. What was worse, was you'd been studying baby development and knew that it was only a matter of time before they started crawling around, and even walking. You would have to baby proof everything, and even then, there was no way your mommy-eyes could be in three directions at once, no matter how hard you tried.

It was time to get help… Sarah was right. You could hire a nanny or someone who could stay here with you and help to take care of them. It would give you time to relax and do fun things outside the house again. But you knew you didn't want to hire someone who would take your place as mommy. You wanted to be there for these girls every minute of their development. They were your pride and joy, and you weren't about to ship them off to be raised by someone else. But still, you couldn't do this alone. Maybe you could use the reality shift web site to make this job easier, and then you wouldn't have to hire someone? You could make yourself a super mom, or even have yourself in two places at once so you could split your time easier. Or perhaps Sarah was right, and all you need is a nice lady to help out.
111132111222221212122112121221111321111.title: Raising the babies.

choices: You get on well with her mom.
You don't get on well with her mom.
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.content:
One day, after dashing from room to room for 15 hours straight while trying to fit baby gates and safety cushions on low sharp corners, you finally caved in and when Sarah came home you were waiting for her in the kitchen having only just put the girls down for a nap.

"I need help Sarah" you say as soon as she walks in.

Sarah sets down her breifcase and takes a seat at the table. "Are you sure Maria. You said you hated the idea of paying someone to raise our girls, even if you are around."


"I know" you say "but if I don't get help soon I think it won't be long till we have an accident. I want to be the one to raise them but if that means putting the girls in danger I'll take all the help I can get." You sigh knowing that this isn't what either of you want.

Sarah sits there for moment, weighing things up. "Well there is one option left before we can consider hiring someone." She says looking up you.

"What is it?" You ask, hopeful.

"Well my mom, has recently retired and wants to spend more time with her granddaughters so we could invite her to stay in the guest room and help you with the kids." She pauses to let this sink in. "I know you two don't always get on but it would be better to have family raising the girls rather than a stranger no matter how qualified they are."

You mull this over. She's right that you and Eleanor have never got along that well. Even when you were still a man she disliked you. You shudder thinking about all the time that you would have to spend with her if she does come and stay.

Sarah reads your expression. "It will only be until we work something more permanent out. It's not like she's going to be staying with us forever. Besides, I heard Helen and Gabriella are doing the same. Gabriela's mom is coming from South America to look after their twins so maybe my mom and her can spend time together to give you a break from her."

You nod at this. Gabriela had delivered her babies two weeks after the triplets were born and you were astounded when Helen announced they now had twin daughters, Amy and Beth. Both had their mother's Latina skin tone while oddly also had Helen's red hair. You hadn't seen mudh of them since the births for understandable reasons.

"So what do you think?" Sarah says.

"Well, I guess it's the best option we've got right now." You say. "How soon can she get hear?"

"I ran the idea past her and she says she can get hear in two days, you can manage that long right?"

"Yeah I guess." You say and slump down on a chair next to Sarah.

She pats your arm "you okay babe?"

"It just feels kinda like admiting defeat. Raising the girls was my job and I couldn't do it" you say.

"Hey, don't talk like that, you've been the best mother ever. Think of all those times I've been late home and you've still managed to look after them without a break while also making me dinner. Think of all the nappies you changed when I was still struggling how to put them on. Your not a failure, your all I could have asked you to be."

You smile, tears welling at your wife's encouragement. She kisses you and you share a rare moment of intimacy since the girls came along. You savour every second.

"Thanks Sarah. I needed that"

'And think of it this way. We could ask my mom to take of the girls for a night every now and then and spend some more intimate time together." Sarah says sultrily.

"I like the way you think" you say giving her a quick peck on the lips before standing up. As you move your chair out, crying starts from upstairs. You can tell from the wails that it is Sofía but it won't be long until her sisters are up and screaming too. "It's your turn." You say to Sarah. "I've got to make dinner." Sarah nods and heads up stairs leaving you with preparing the meal and a mind now at ease that your aren't hiring someone.
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.title: Give in and hire a nice lady who can help you r...

choices: Sarah convinces Eleanor to come back and patch up your differences.
Eleanor completely moves out, so you now need a new helper.
Eleanor doesn't move out yet, but clashes with you some more.
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.content:
A week later, Sarah's mother Eleanor had agreed to move into the guest bedroom to help raise the girls. She arrived in the morning before Sarah headed out to the office, carrying a couple suitcases of clothes and personal items. It was clear she wasn't planning on moving in permanently, and she travelled light. She was in her sixties, and her natural blonde hair had begun graying at the roots, except she periodically kept it dyed so no one could tell. She typically dressed very plainly, in long skirts or pants, quite the opposite from your usual clothing style.

Eleanor entered the house giving her daughter a loving embrace, and a kiss on the cheek. "Oh it's so good to see you honey, I can't wait to see my grandkids again! Are they walking yet?"

Sarah smiled, "No mom, not for another couple months. That's when we'll really need your help especially."

Eleanor scoffed and nodded, giving you a nasty glare. "You mean Maria can't keep up with three babies that can't even crawl yet? You have all this money and when I was raising you and your brother I had nothing, just keep that in mind, Sarah."

You were about to defend yourself, arguing that triplets were different, but you held your tongue, not wanting to cause an argument with her. She was here to help, after all, so it would be best if you got along with your mother in law.

Instead, you said, "I'm just glad you're kind enough to help out, thank you!"

Eleanor gave you a condescending look through her bifocal glasses, and simply grunted, "Mhm."

Sarah awkwardly stared at the two of you, before blurting out, "Alright, good, everyone's friends then! Now if you'll excuse me I am really needed in the office today. Super super busy, I'll see you tonight honey! Thank's again mom!"

Your wife gave you a tender kiss on the lips and hugged her mom before rushing out the door.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------

Eleanor unpacked her things in the guest bedroom, and you poked your head inside to see how she was situating, "Settling in alright, Eleanor? Anything I can get you?"

She sat on the edge of the bed and stared at you, before simply shaking her head a moment later. "You don't have to be all friendly with me, I'm only here for my grandkid's sake, and because Sarah asked nicely."

You frowned, not liking where this was going... but you tried to maintain your cool. "Alright... I'll keep that in mind. Again... thanks for the help."

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------

Much of the time spent home with Eleanor went this way, as she didn't seem to have an ounce of respect for you. However, when she was around the babies, she was a whole other person. She was very attentive to them, changing their diapers, feeding them by the bottle, and even attempting to play with them. She would make silly faces and noises, and the girls seemed to laugh and enjoy it. Except Sofía, who would cry whenever your mother-in-law made a silly noise.

Several days later, it was Eleanor's turn to feed the babies again, and you heard the screaming and wailing of your daughters from the other room. You rushed in immediately to see what was going on, and Eleanor seemed to have her hands full. Sofía and Ellie were both together on Eleanor's lap, as she tried to feed them both at the same time. Neither girl was having it, flailing their little hands around and screaming their heads off. Alexa was sat in her high chair watching her sisters freak out, and seemed to be giggling and enjoying the show. Eleanor was practically pulling her hair out in frustration trying to get them to eat.

"Eleanor, you know you can't feed Ellie and Sofía at the same time? They really don't like it; that's just how they are." You advised her while picking up Sofía into your arms. She quickly calmed down when she felt her mommy's embrace.

Your mother-in-law glared at you, still clearly on edge from all the trouble she was having. "Oh, and you expect ME to take your advice on how to parent properly? I raised your wife MY way, and she turned out perfect. So don't tell me how to feed a baby."

You finally had it; she pushed too many of your buttons. Your face turned red, so you quickly sat Sofía down in her crib before turning around and getting in Eleanor's face. "What the hell does THAT mean?! You may be my wife's mother, but you did NOT carry these triplets for nine months. I am their mother, and I know their personalities better than anyone!"

Eleanor sneered, "You can't fool me. You're still just a self-righteous know it all like a man. That's all you are, how dare you call yourself the mother of my grandchildren. A man can not be a mother, everyone knows that."

"Excuse me? DO I LOOK LIKE A MAN TO YOU?! DO I? NO. I am a mother, and a woman, and your daughter's wife. And don't you forget that." You practically spat in her face, standing over her as she continued to sit on the couch.

She sat your daughter, Ellie, down, and stood up to face you. She was taller than you since you were currently wearing flats, and you were forced to look up at her. She saw what appeared physically to be a beautiful nineteen-year-old Venezuelan girl where you stood, but in her eyes, you were just a perverted man posing as a woman.

"No, you're right, you don't look like a man. You look like a freak." She snarled at you, before grabbing her purse and leaving the house.

You knew she was old-fashioned, and still wasn't used to a world where people could change their appearance for a price, but that was just cold. She really cut you deep. You picked up Ellie into your arms, and holding her was the only thing keeping you from breaking down into tears.
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.title: You don't get on well with her mom.

choices: Try to tell her what really happened.
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.content:
Sarah gets home before her mother that night and finds you cooking dinner with your eyes red from crying. She immediately sits you down and asks you what happened. You tell her all about your fight with Eleanor earlier and about how she called you a freak. Sarah took you in her arms and comforted you but what she has to say was less than comforting.

"You gotta realise Maria that my mom isn't used to all this and it's hard for her to come to terms with how her family is now. She's been against all this gender change stuff from the start and my brother doesn't help things when he visits her and puts ideas in her head."

Sarah's little brother Jake was a small time office worker and had been badly affected by all the changes going on in the world. He had lost his job as a floor manager to a young girl fresh out of collage and in an effort to keep his job, reluctantly agreed to become her secretary so he was especially bitter like a lot of men now. He lived close to Eleanor so visited regularly and placed the blame (rightly in your case) on people like you and Sarah for all his troubles.

Nevertheless, you can't believe what you are hearing, Sarah is actually taking her mother's side in this and making you seem insensitive. "She was just being nasty for the sake of nastiness." You protest. "She tried to say I had no right raising my own daughters." You stare at Sarah in disbelief.

"I know she may say things like that but she doesn't mean it. She's just venting" Sarah says trying to take your hand but you withdraw it away from her.

"You're joking aren't you?" You exclaim. "She called me a freak. A FREAK! That's a hell of a thing to not mean."

Sarah sighs. "If you want I'll talk to her when she gets back"

"Sarah, I want you to want to talk to her. Your my wife want you to take my side in this. I've been nothing but accommodating to her. I made her breakfast in bed for the first week for goodness sake but do I get any thanks? No, just snarls and grunts and complaints about how I've over or underdone the toast." You pant for breathe having practically shouted all that.

Sarah looks at you dumbstruck by your outburst. "Well... Umm, you do sometimes overdo the toast babe" she says with a small apologetic grin.

You hit the roof. "WHAT!" You yell standing up. Sarah immediately realises her poor choice of words and ducks for cover as you fling an egg timer at her. "Well if my cooking is so dreadful why don't you get mommy to do it for you, I'm sure she'd be happy to show how better she is at than the FREAK!" You pick up a plastic jug and hurl that too.

"Calm down Maria" Sarah says poking her head up from under the table as though it were a trench.

"You're on the couch tonight." You say stalking out of the kitchen and up the stairs.

You pass your daughter's rooms and marvel that none of them have woken up with all the noise downstairs. You keep going, go in your room, close the door and then fling yourself on the bed and start sobbing into a pillow. You can't believe that after all you have been through Sarah would take her mom's side in all this. After all you have done for her. After about ten minutes of crying, you hear a knock on the door.

"Maria, I'm sorry." You hear Sarah say softly. "I'll speak to my mom as soon as she gets back."

You don't say anything and wait for her to go.

"Okay, I'll leave you alone now" she says and you hear her footsteps going away.

You stay curled up on the bed for some time. You hear the front door open as Eleanor returns at around 9:00 PM and you wonder what she could have been up to all day. You eventually get up and change into a babydoll nightie and climb into bed. You shiver a little, not having Sarah there to cuddle you but you know you made the right decision. Thankfully sleep comes and your mind rests.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------------------------

The next morning, your alarm goes off at its usual time of 6:30. Your the first up in the house each morning so you can make breakfast and give the babies their morning feed but you are surprised that you were not woken in the night at all by any of them crying. Perhaps you were so tired that you slept right through. The events of yesterday come floods back and you immediately feel guilty. It always happened, even if you were in the right or had the moral high ground when you had an argument with Sarah, you were the first to apologise and make things up. You hated fighting and you can't help feeling now that perhaps you were unreasonable.

After showering, doing your hair and makeup and dressing in a summer dress you knew Sarah liked you in, you made your morning rounds and fed each of your daughters. Sophía was particularly quiet today as though she knew something had happened but the other two seemed happy as normal. You took all three of them down with you, but them in their high chairs and started on making a special apology breakfast for Sarah.

When you had finished as well as laying the table for you and Eleanor to eat as well, you take Sarah's tray up to the guest room you figured she slept in and knock on the door. She opens it, clearly in the middle of getting dressed and looks at you wearily, perhaps expecting another salvo of kitchen utensils.

You smile at her sweetly before handing her the tray. "I'm sorry about yesterday Sarah. I kinda blew a fuse, can you forgive me."

Sarah gratefully takes the tray and places it down inside the room. "Of course babe." She says and draws you in for a quick kiss. "Oh and I talked to my mom and she said she's willing to move on and forget yesterday if you apologise" Sarah says this as if it is good news.

"What?" You say, trying to hold back the anger that had just resurfaced again.

"Yeah, she felt really sorry about saying all those things but you did start it by shouting at her for feeding Ellie and Sophía at the same time and for rubbing in the fact you used to be a man. You know how she feels about that Maria" she says in disappointed tone.

Your eyes buldge cartoonishly, is she really again laying the blame on you again?

"But but" you stutter.

"No buts Maria, I'll be down in minute and I expect to see you apologise to her before I leave for work." With that, Sarah closes the door.

Clearly Eleanor had spun a tale implicating you as the bad guy but how could Sarah have believed it, was she that blind to her mothers spitefulness.

You head downstairs and find Eleanor sat at the breakfast table reading the morning paper. She smirks at you as you enter.

"Well I heard you through a right old tantrum last night." She says while tickling Alexas foot causing her to giggle.

"You lied to Sarah and blamed it all on me" you say keeping your voice low.

"But it is all your fault Maria." She says plainly, turning the page of the newspaper. "You're the problem not me. But don't worry I'm more than willing to let all slide when you apologise to me in front of Sarah." She chuckles at this softly.

You clench your fist and are about to reply but Sarah enters the kitchen. "Morning" she says.

"Good morning dear" Eleanor says beaming at her daughter.

Sarah looks at you both. "Are you both getting along?" She asks cautiously.

You are about to say that you most certainly aren't getting along but Eleanor beats you to if. "Oh yes dear. In fact I had just said I was sorry for talking inappropriately to Maria yesterday. I shouldn't have let her wind me up like that." You glower at her. "Oh and Maria was just telling me how bad she felt for starting it all and was about to apologise." She smiles at you.

"Well Maria?" Sarah says expectantly.

You feel totally helpless. If you apologise Eleanor wins and you are branded the bad guy so she will be more likely to believed in the future but if you don't and start another argument, you are still the bad guy, Eleanor will no doubt feign innocence and Sarah will fall out with you again since she seems to have already chosen her side.
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.title: Eleanor doesn't move out yet, but clashes w...

choices: Eleanor softens a bit, offering to just set it all behind her and move on.
Eleanor refuses to let this go.  She needs to make you look bad somehow.
Eleanor actually apologizes to everyone's shock.
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.content:
You knew what Eleanor was up to, but there was no way you were going to let her disparage you in front of your wife that easily. You felt a hot flash rising through your body, to your head, as your temper began to spark. You noticed as Maria you were definitely quick to anger, a lot more than you used to be as a man, or even as other women before you settled on Maria. As Taeko you had been more submissive and quiet. And as Maria, you were extroverted and open with your emotion. There was just something about being in a different body that seeped into your personality.

However, this time, you closed your eyes and took a deep breath, not wanting to let your fiery temper get the better of you. You knew that you had to show that you were a reasonable and civil woman who would stand up for her children and her principles.

"Alright, I'll apologize." You started. You saw a smirk begin to form on Eleanor's face. But then you added, "I'll apologize if you agree to apologize as well."

Eleanor took a breath to speak, but Sarah beat her to it, saying, "Maria! You're just being immature now, this is childish!"

You calmly responded, "Sarah, I am your wife, and all I want is for this to be fair. Don't you trust the word of your wife?"

Sarah folded her arms, feeling cornered between two people she trusted, "Well... yeah. But we all know how quickly your Latina temper gets the better of you. I don't know why you can't just apologize."

"Because that is not the whole truth. Eleanor misrepresented what happened. Yes, it's true, my temper was quite high yesterday, and I apologize for escalating the argument." You tried to remain as calm as possible so they couldn't use your temper against you.

Eleanor jumped in before you could continue, "Yes, apology accepted, now we can-"

"However." You interrupted her, struggling to maintain your composure. "If I recall, it all started when I was trying to give you helpful advice about how to feed the babies that I gave birth to. Sarah told me that apparently I yelled at you for that, which is absolutely not true. If you misinterpreted my advice as somehow condescending, then perhaps that's where our misunderstanding started."

It took every ounce of your being to contain yourself, since you really wanted to just pick up the nearest object and hurl it at your mother-in-law in her smug face. Meanwhile Sarah looked back and forth between the two of you, apparently conflicted about who to believe.

Eleanor responded, "Well, whoever instigated the argument is quite irrelevant. In the end, I was not the one yelling in front of the babies. I would never raise my voice around children so young. Sarah knows that for a fact."

Sarah nodded, "She's right. Mom has always been quiet, and I think I've only heard her yell once in my life."

"Yes but I..." You blurted out, but no words were coming to you. She was right, you had yelled your brains out at her, right in front of all three girls. Eleanor was always quiet, deviously so, even when she was irritated. Right, but she doesn't have to be loud to be a cruel old bag...

You cleared your throat, feeling like this whole conversation was getting you nowhere. You couldn't win with logic, but perhaps they could be swayed by emotion. "I... sincerely do apologize, to my daughters, for using harsh language around them... I just..."

You stopped midsentence, channeling all of your anger towards Eleanor into raw emotion. You couldn't let yourself be angry, so the emotion had to come out somewhere... You suddenly clasped your hand in front of your mouth and flopped down into the nearest chair. Your hand was legitimately shaking as you burst into tears. This was something you rarely ever did, even as a woman, so it quickly got Sarah's attention. At first, you had planned on faking tears, but to your surprise, it was actually coming naturally. Your mascara was starting to run, as you closed your eyes and began rocking back and forth in the chair.

"Maria are you alright? Sweetie... You don't have to go into detail if you don't want..." Sarah sat next to you and cradled your head in her embrace.

For a moment Eleanor continued to stare smugly at you, but when she saw Sarah's worried reaction to your breakdown. She looked annoyed that you were getting all the attention now. To her, this was just a man trying to abuse feminine tactics to get what he wants. She expected you to fake crying, but with your legitimate breakdown, it was beginning to look all too real. She wanted to slam you for confessing to using harsh language around the kids, but knew that now it would make her sound like the villain for being insensitive. Eleanor just kept her mouth shut for now.

You wiped your face with a hand, smudging your makeup even further, which only made you more emotional. "I just want to be a good mother Sarah; that's all I want. These girls are my whole universe! They're more than just my life, because I gave that up already to make sure they could exist safely. They're more than my world, because I gave that up as well. They're my universe, Sarah. There is nothing more important." It wasn't a lie; with the changes to reality you had created a whole new world, and left the old one far behind, along with your male life. The fact that this weighed so heavily on your conscience conveniently helped ensure your breakdown didn't look fake.

Sarah understood most of what you said through the emotional blubbering, and just continued holding you, rocking you back and forth almost like she was your mother, rocking her child. She just kept repeating, "I know, honey, I know. And I'm grateful for everything you've given up, I truly am..."

Eleanor continued to stand there with her arms folded and scowling. She watched as her daughter consoled a physically young latina woman that was her spouse. For a split second, Eleanor may have seen the sobbing young woman for what she truly was: an actual woman. In that moment she didn't see you as a perverted man wearing false skin, but simply as someone her daughter loved dearly.
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.title: Try to tell her what really happened.

1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.content:
Sophía, seeing you in such distress joined you in tears and sobs which then triggered Alexa and Ellie. The whole kitchen echoed with the wails of your family. Eleanor looked around at chaos and her expression of disgust changed to worry and then sympathy as her eyes fell on you once more still being cradled in Sarah's arms. Something in her changes at that moment and it allows her to see clearly what she has for the first time. A beautiful and successful daughter and a beautiful daughter in law who has just brought three of her grandchildren into the world.

"Maria." She starts with a sigh trying to speak over the screams of the babies. "Maria can we put all of this behind us and bury the hatchet."

Your eyes widen as you hear this and you turn to face Eleanor.

"You clearly want the best for you family and I just didn't see it until now. I can honestly say that I love these girls with all my heart and so do you and that's enough."

The girl's crying starts to calm as they see you are now longer distraught.

"Do you mean that? Really?" You say wiping away mascara tears from your cheek.

"I do" she says firmly. "I think it's time to stop being silly and while I may not agree with things about you" she pauses for a moment. "We have to move past our differences for the girls."

You can't believe where all this is coming from. It seems a woman's tears really are a dangerous weapon. "I'd like that" you say with a sniffle.

"Great" she says with a small smile. "So why don't we start things right. I'll tend to the girls and you go and fix up yourself. Your makeup has run.

You look to Sarah who still has her arms around you and smile. "I think I will do that." You say and stand and head for the stairs. "Thank you Eleanor" you say before you leave the room and go upstairs.

When in your room, you go straight to the mirror to examine yourself. Your makeup is ruined making you look a complete state and the tears have run and landed on your dress staining it. You tut as you get to work, stripping out of the dress and heading for the bathroom to wash your face and reapply. When done with that, you throw on a black top and a grey miniskirt before leaving your room.

Before heading downstairs you stop and smile thinking on what Eleanor said about putting aside differences and working together. You notice Eleanor's room is open and see that her washing hamper is full and her bed isn't made so perhaps doing her personal chores will show your sincerity to her.
