"I think you should take your dinner in your room Jake." Sarah says rising to her feet and laying down her authority.

Jake just stands, grabs his plate and heads for the stairs. He turns to you finally before disappearing. "Thanks for the food... Traitor." He spits and then he is gone.

Silence falls upon the table as Sarah takes her seat again and you all pick at your meals, noone seeming to be hungry anymore.

The silence is broken by a loud splat as Ellie launches what is left of her dinner at Sophía who takes it all fully in the face. Ellie giggles and babbles while Sophía begins to wail. Despite what has just been said, you all can't help but laugh at this.

"I'll get her" Eleanor says, rising from her seat.

As Sarah and Eleanor take care of the girl's you tidy away meal, washing up the plates and storing the desert, a homemade cheesecake which you are quite proud of, away since you didn't get chance to start it.

Sarah comes in and kisses you on the cheek reassuringly. "Im sorry about Jake. I'll ask him to leave as soon as we have opened the presents tomorrow. You were right, it was a mistake to invite him." She kisses you again trying to make it up to you.

"You don't need to do that. He may have made a scene but he didn't upset the girls. He kept his voice down and I'm sure he just needed to get it all out. Just look where we live Sarah. It's like a continuing reminder of what a failure he is. Plus he did have a point, things have changed and not all for the better." You say this last part glumly, fully aware of your part in his strife.

"I know he's right Maria but now is not the time to be blaming me or insulting you but if you are sure, I'll give him another chance. Lets just hope he cools down up there.


---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------

The rest of Christmas Eve is pretty uneventful. You all watch a few holiday specials on television and then have an early night before the big day. You especially need one as you will need to be up very early to prepare the Christmas dinner.

As you climb into bed with Sarah a thought hits you. Maybe the socks and aftershave aren't the presents Jake needs from you this year. Maybe he needs something a little more, maybe something to help him to adapt to this new world or maybe change the world a little for him.

There is only one way you know you can do this so you quickly climb out of bed, tell Sarah you will be right back and then pad over to the study to boot up the computer and bring up Reality Shift.net.

"Merry Christmas from all here at Realityshift.net. We wish you all the best in this holiday season"

You smile at this festive message and notice that snowflake graphics are falling around the site.

You sit and stare at the screen trying to come up with a way things could be made better for Jake.
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.title: Jake gets confrontational with you at dinner.

choices: Christmas morning, Jake announces that he's becoming a changer.
Reality changes so Jake is already a changer, and has a girlfriend too!
Oops... the website made worldwide reality changes to convince Jake.
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.content:
Right now all you could think of was how glad you were that you ended up as Maria, and you really just wished Jake could have happiness like that. You just wanted your family to stop fighting and get along for once!

You typed: "Jake will finally accept that becoming a woman is the best way to go. He will find the right new identity that suits him best, and it'll lead to him having a much happier and healthier life."

Before you stopped to think if this was even ethical, you hit enter and made the change happen. You didn't see anything change, but you were also still alone in your office. You didn't feel like risking going to his room to check on him, so you decided it would be best to just get some sleep and see how it turns out in the morning...
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.title: Jake has undergone a gender change and is very ...

choices: Ella has a very special gift for Jessica.
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.content:
Christmas morning came earlier for you than Sarah as you woke around 5:45 am to make a start on the Christmas dinner. You smiled as you looked at your sleeping wife before you crept out of bed and into the shower. You dress in your Chistmas costume of a red Santa like dress, white stockings and red heels before doing up your makeup and hair and then going down stairs trying your hardest not to wake any of your girls up. You succeed and stop at the foot of the tree and smile again. There is quiet over the house that only ever seems to be enjoyed by the first up on Christmas morning. The presents glisten under the tree, waiting to be opened by your girls. You sigh and head to the kitchen and almost jump as you see someone already in there holding a knife.

You don't scream but watch as the woman with the knife proceeds to use it to chop vegetables on the counter. She is just a little taller than you, with long blonde hair and pale skin. She is wearing a sexy Christmas costume too, her's being a reindeer from what you can tell from the antlers from the head band.
Deciding she is not a threat you call out.

"Hello?" You say

The woman turns and you see the woman to be what looks to be a smaller, daintier more feminine version of Sarah. Her face lights up as she sees you.

"Merry Christmas Maria" she says in a naturally sweet voice. "Ready to start on the dinner."

You stare at her trying to figure out what has happened. "Who... Are you?" You say slowly.

The woman giggles lightly. "Oh did you have too much sherry last night? It's me Jessica..." She pauses to let this sink in but you still stare blankly at her. "Sarah's sister." She adds looking a little confused now herself.

"But Sarah doesn't have a.... Oh" you stop yourself as you remember using the website to change Jake last night. This must be him now. That would explain why he looks so much like Sarah. Your brain catches up with this reality as you remember now that Jake finally gave in and got the change four months ago, now goes by Jessica and has been loving it. You feel like you two are quite close now as memories of you two meeting up regularly come swirling back. "Sorry Jess, I still half asleep" you say making up an excuse and clicking over to her in your heels. "Yeah, let's get to work." You pick up a knife and start peeling potatos.

You both chat easily as you get dinner ready as though you have known each other a while. The memory of the angry Jake of the night before is quickly fading as all you see now is the happy petite blonde Jessica now stood before you. You are glad that your present has worked out and that all seems well. At 9, you hear movement on the stairs and the everyone else comes down stairs. Eleanor is carrying Ellie looking happier than you have seen her before while Sarah carries Sophía and Alexa down wearing a pair of jeans and a Christmas jumper Eleanor knitted. Eleanor puts Ellie in the girl's pen and then immediatly comes over to you and Jessica.

She comes over and gives Jessica a big hug. "Happy birthday Jessica." She says happily.

You stare at this as you would have expected Eleanor to be extremely bitter about losing her only son if you were anything to go by but no.

"Happy birthday mom" Jessica responds.

They break their hug and to your shock, Eleanor turns to you. "And merry Christmas to my favourite daughter in law" your brain has trouble registering this but you hug Eleanor back none the less. Perhaps her son changing was enough to convince her that changing is a good way to go.

"Maybe not your favourite for too long." A voice comes from over Eleanor's shoulder and you see a tall woman with long black hair and sharp beautiful features standing in the living room next to Sarah.
Your mind quickly comes up with a name for her. Ella she is Jessica's girlfriend, the one who originally encouraged to make the change.

"Merry Christmas baby" Jessica squeals, running up to Ella. Ella picks her up as she arrives and kisses Jessica heavily before setting her down on her feet again.

"Merry Christmas Jess." She says with a grin. "Dinner smells delicious, you and Maria have done a great job.

"Thanks" Jessica says with a playful curtsy and returns to the kitchen.

You all exchange festive greetings before getting down to opening presents around the tree. You gather the girls round, ensuring Ellie is not near Sophía and with Sarah videoing it all, you begging opening the parcels under the tree.
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.title: Reality changes so Jake is already a changer, a...

choices: The rest of Christmas day, you learn more about your last reality change.
Skip forward, your daughters are growing up and have cousins now.
You're tempted to change reality a little bit more...
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.content:
With all of the excitement of gifts being opened, you quickly forgot about Jessica's transformation and began to accept her as your new sister-in-law. Firstly, your daughters all got to open presents of their own, though of course, they needed a little help. Once shown how to open presents, Ellie learned fast and eagerly tore into the wrapping paper. You kneeled down and opened the box for her, revealing a cute little yellow toddler sized dress that you knew she would soon grow into.

"Oh, what's this? It's a dress, for you sweetie! How did Santa know your color?" You explained to Ellie, beaming at how happy she seemed as she looked it over.

Alexa opened hers shortly after, finding a red dress in hers. Finally, Sofia opened her gift, which was a purple dress in the same style as her two sisters. However just as you thought the girls were happy with their gifts, Ellie waddled over and grabbed the purple dress out of Sofia's hand, causing her to fall backwards onto her butt. Sofia began to bawl, swinging her arms around in Ellie's direction.

"Ellie Bennet! That gift was for Sofía! Give it back now!" You immediately switched on your stern motherly voice and even slipped into your old latina accent for a moment, which you had tried so hard to hide all these years.

When Ellie refused to give back the dress, Sarah crouched down and gently tried to take it from her. This only made Ellie cry as well, but finally, she dropped the dress and it was returned to its rightful recipient. The whole time Alexa just sat on the floor holding her red dress and staring at Sofía and Ellie in confusion.

"Well... Merry Christmas girls!" Sarah said, exasperated and trying to clean up the mess of wrapping paper.

While everyone waited for the remaining gifts to be handed out, you noticed Jess and Ella sitting together like a lovely couple, with Ella even holding Jess's hand and muttering something to her. You had a feeling you knew just what they were talking about after seeing how adorable your daughters were.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------

Several gift exchanges later, and it looked like all of the gifts under the tree were gone. But Jessica hadn't received anything from her lovely girlfriend.

"Hey... is that it?" You asked, taking a better look under the tree and making double sure you hadn't missed anything. When you looked over to Ella you saw her stand up from the couch and reach deep into her purse.

"I'm sorry I think there's one more..." Ella said softly as she knelt down on one knee and pulled a small box out of her purse.

Everyone gasped, and you even covered your mouth with one hand out of surprise. However, when you looked over to Sarah, she didn't seem all that genuinely surprised. She just had a silly grin on her face as she watched her little sister break down in tears. It was obvious what was happening, but seeing Jess like this suddenly made you remember Jake. It was hard to picture Jake as this petite blonde woman, and acting so emotional at being proposed to. But clearly, as Jessica, her personality was quite different. Makes sense, my personality changed quite a bit when I became Maria, even different from when I was Taeko...

"Oh my god!" Jessica screamed from behind her hands as the box opened, revealing a sparkling ring with a giant rock on the top.

Suddenly you were hit with a flash of memory about Ella. You recalled her being from a middle-class family, with a decent paying job as a saleswoman. There was no way she could have afforded a ring that nice, but the way Sarah was grinning was a bit telling.

But there was no way you would ruin the moment by saying anything like that. You just watched as Jessica screamed out "Yes!" and leapt into Ella's arms, nearly causing her to drop the ring. Luckily Jess was petite enough to be carried, and Ella seemed like a rather strong woman, so she briefly carried Jess back over to the couch and laid her down for a long kiss in front of the whole family.

Your mother-in-law was cheering them on, and you joined in, while keeping an eye on your daughters so they didn't crawl away into trouble. "Congratulations, it's about time, you two!"
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.title: Ella has a very special gift for Jessica.

1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.content:
After a long time kissing and cuddling on the couch, Jess finally drags herself away from Ella, albeit very reluctantly to help you with the rest of the dinner. You congratulate her and smile as she keeps holding out her hand so she can admire the sizeable diamond ring on her finger. She chatters endlessly about how this is so romantic and the best Christmas present she could ever have hoped for. You feel gladness deep down that your reality shift really did seem to work out for the better, even if there is little left of the original Jake.

It takes you a little longer than planned to cook Christmas dinner, what with Jess being in a lovey daze but it gets done and you both call people in for the food and place their portions in front of them. Sarah gives a quick toast to the couple and then you all dig in. Everything seems to be out of a dream. Everyone is laughing and joking and just generally enjoying each other's company.

When dinner is over and you and Jess are washing up while the others are watching TV in the living room, you click on the kitchen tv to help pass the time with some background noise.

You seem to catch the tail end of a documentary regarding changers. Jess requests that you change it to something less boring but you are somehow compelled to keep it on.

From the documentary, you learn that the 97% of male to female changers in relationships now, identify as the more femme partner and adopt that role very easily. 95% percent of them take their partners last name in marriage, 91% of them are the ones who bear the children in female-female relationships, and 86% become full time homemakers and stay at home moms. Scientists are still debating why changers exhibit such hyper feminine traits and behaviour while ordinary woman seem to becoming more assertive in all areas of life.

You are stunned by the conclusions of the programme as this was not the state of the world the day before the change. Perhaps your change to Jake inadvertently messed with the minds of all men making them more naturally submissive and then even more so when they make the gender change. You shake your head trying to rid yourself of these thoughts. "Everything is great now. The change is for the best." You think to yourself.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------

As the rest of Christmas Day progresses, Eleanor becomes more and more tipsy from eggnog to the point where she is giggling uncontrollably in her arm chair. Everyone finds this funny since you all have had too much booze as well but Sarah finally takes her to bed when she walks into the kitchen wall when going to get a refill. She bids everyone one a cheery goodnight before being led to her bedroom by Sarah. The girls are all napping quietly in their pen. Ellie was the last to fall asleep, keeping her eyes constantly upon Sophía's purple dress until she couldn't keep them open any longer. You look over at Ella and Jess. Ella is sat on the adjacent couch with Jess sat on her lap. Jess looks back and smiles.

"I want to thank you for having us over" she says.

"It's now problem, your family, both of you" you nod to Ella who grins.

"Your such a good friend Maria, so that's why I can't think of anyone better to be my maid of honour at our wedding." She says beaming.

You are taken aback by the suddenness of all this and the booze makes you all emotional and flustered too. "What me.... I'd love to" you say gushing and tears welling up. You stand and wobble on your heels slightly. Jess stands too and you both hug very tightly.

"Thank you." You say when you move apart.

"It was an easy choice, plus who else can I trust to organise my hen night?" She laughs.

Your eyes widen, you had foot ten about all the ins and outs of the bridal party, it wasn't all going to be dress fittings and flower arranging, you had a serious job ahead of you. You settle back in your chair and try to wrack your addled mind for ideas but come up with none.

"I think we'll turn in now." Ella says standing, picking Jess up as she did so causing her to shriek happily.

"Good night." You say with a smile. "I won't be far behind, I've just got to put the girls to bed.

They both bid you a goodnight before Ella carries Jess up the stars with her giggling all the way.

You get up a moment later and gently scoop up the sleeping forms of Sophía and Ellie. Luckily, they don't wake or else they would have been squabbling in an instant. You softly head up stairs and first lay down Sophía, kissing her on her tiny head and then doing the same to Ellie. You smile down at your beautiful daughter and feel all is as it should be. Leaving Ellie's room, you see Sarah pass, carrying Alexa, who is now awake and wide eyed into her room. You tickle her little hand and she grins.

"I'll take care of her, don't worry. Get some rest babe, you've been working non-stop all day.

You take her advice and head for your bedroom, change into your lacey nightie and then slide into between the warm sheets. Sarah is not long behind you and snuggles you close with you being the little spoon. You don't talk at all, you just fall asleep in her arms, in rhythm with her heart beat.
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.title: The rest of Christmas day, you learn more about...

1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.content:
http://www.whensallymetsally.co.uk/files...

You smile at the photo Jessica and Ella's first kiss as a married couple. You remember all of it vividily, well the hen night is a little hazy but the rest is all there. Dress choosing, helping Jessica with picking caterers, the mini crisis on the day of the wedding where the Jessica's dress seemed to vanish, only to be found after an extensive search of the hotel the bridal party was staying on its way to the laundry room.

The location of the wedding was beautiful, a small grotto on the edge of the beach nestled in the trees. Sarah insisted that she foot the bill for the ceremony, dresses, suits and reception and Ella graciously accepted.

When Jess was finally in her dress and the car pulled up at the location, you will never forget that look of pure happiness on her face, she was practically glowing in her full length dress with her veil down, she was a vision.

You swear that as she walked down the aisle, Ella's eyes bulged in her skull. Ella herself chose to wear a shirt and trousers and stood at the end of the aisle waiting for her bride to approach. All the guests whispered excitedly about how gorgeous the bride was and Eleanor, who was to give away her daughter to Ella, almost broke down before the "I do's" were said.

The marriage was simple in itself and when it was declared that Ella may kiss the bride, she lifted Jess's veil and locked lips with her new wife. Everyone erupted with cheers and applause as Ms and Mrs. Kershaw left for the reception and meal.

"It's hard to believe it's been five years since then" you murmur to yourself.

You are torn from your revery by loud screeching and a terrible bang, closely followed by "Moooooom!" Yelled.

You sigh, leave your room and head to investigate the noise, knowing you aren't going to like what you find. It is currently around 4pm on a Tuesday and the sun is still bright lighting up the house nicely. As you round the corner towards the obvious place where the noise could have originated,the girls' rooms, you see Alexa stood at the doorway of Sophía's room, looking in with an alarmed look on her face.

Alexa, like all your girls, has grown a lot in the past five years. She has black hair, and shares a lighter version of your Latina skin tone. Out of all of your girls, she is easily the least excitable and most level headed. She is also the smartest by far. Since starting elementary school, she is consistently praised to be the smartest there despite only being six. You and Sarah are immensely proud of her and through a little encouragement is learning to play both piano and violin. Despite this, you feel that Alexa is your only daughter who has a closer relationship with her father, Sarah than she does with you.

"What's going on" you say in the stern voice you reserve for the gravest situations.

Alex's looks up and points into Sophía's room. "In there mom, they're fighting again."

You roll your eyes and prepare yourself for the latest bout in what has proved to be a 5 year grudge match that shows no sign of stopping.

You are unsurprised to see your other two daughters, Ellie and Sophía fighting on the floor. This alone does not surprise you, what does is that it Sophía's wardrobe is now on its side with one of the doors hanging open. "That explains the bang" you think. "But how in the world did they knock it over."

Your daughter Ellie is the live wire of the family. With her pale skin and blonde hair, she is easily the most distinguishable out of your daughters. She is also the loudest. When she comes across something she doesn't like, everyone knows about it. She is also the most mischievous, regular prancing or tricking, you, Sarah, Sophía and also her friends. She comes across as a girly girl in her interests but often plays innocent to avoid getting in trouble. When arguments do break out between her and Sophía, if you trace it back, it is usually her who started it but despite this, she has a good relationship with you, Alexa and deep down really loves Sophía.

Sophía really is a girly girly, preferring, cute things like stuffed animals, dolls and skirts and dresses. She really takes after you in a lot of ways. She is quiet, polite and shy usually but when she is upset, that Latina anger really comes out. Because of her quiet nature, she is usally the one who comes off worse when squabbling with Ellie and is also the quickest to tears. Perhaps as a result of this, she is also the kindest and is praised at school for being nice to everyone. She won't admit it but she too really loves her sister Ellie despite all the fights.

You take in the scene fully. Ellie has pinned Sophía to the ground and is trying to pull her hair. Both are screaming and neither notice you enter.

"What on earth do you think you are doing?" You yell at the top of your voice.

Both girls stop screaming and look in your direction. Their faces drop as they see you.

"Get off the floor this instant!" You snap and Ellie scrambles off Sophía and both climb to their feet looking very sorry for themselves. "Explain this." You point at the wardrobe. At once Ellie and Sophía both begin babbling at the same time, clearly trying to assign blame to the other. "Quiet!", they both immediately stop their babbling. "Sophía, why is your wardrobe on its side?"

"Ellie pushed it over for no reason mommy." She says with puppy dog eyes.

"Did not" Ellie yells.

"Did so" Sophía replies.

"Quiet" you yell again. "Ellie, what are you doing in Sophía's room, you know your not supposed to be in here and why is her wardrobe on the floor?"

Ellie looks at the fallen wardrobe with mirth in her eyes. "I came in to help Sophía dress for dance but she didn't want any help and pushed her wardrobe at me."

"You liar." Sophía shouts, shaking with anger.

"Alexa, what happened?" You say with a sigh.

"Ellie did come in to help Sophía dress for dance but Sophía told Ellie to get out but Ellie wouldn't. Sophía tried to get Ellie out put Ellie pushed her into the wardrobe and it fell over. I told her not to go in mom." She looks up at you with mournful eyes.

"Thank you Alexa. So it seems both of you lied." You say scowling at your daughters.

"But Ellie started it mommy." Sophía protests.

"No buts, if you had told the truth you wouldn't be in trouble too, as for you Ellie, just wait till your father hears about this."

Ellie's eyes drop to her feet.

"I'm sorry" she murmurs.

"Oh your not sorry yet but you will be, both of you" you look at Sophía too. "Now I want all of you in your dance uniforms in ten minutes, so we can leave. Understand?" They all nod. "Good, and if I hear as much as a peep from you, you won't be going to your cousin Hannah's birthday party. "

At that you leave the room and return to your room. You sigh after you close the door behind. Being a stay at home mom to three really takes it out of you.

You strip out of your day clothes and into your dancewear. Tuesday and Thursday evenings is ballet class for the girls and you help out as a teacher. You put your hair up in a ribbon and pick up your bag to leave http://galleries.britishmodelgirls.co.uk... when you turn to see Sarah in her work suit, standing in the bedroom door smiling at you.

Thanks to reality shift.net, Sarah has aged maybe a year in appearance so is still as beautiful as ever.

"I always love you in that outfit." She says still smiling.

"I'm sure you wouldn't look bad in it yourself." You say.

"Are you taking them to dance then?" She says walking over to you.

"Yeah and could you do me a favour and put Sophía's wardrobe back up while I'm gone. Ellie and Sophía knocked it over fighting again, I was hoping you could have a word with them."

Sarah sighs, much like you did after resolving the situation. "Will it ever stop?" She says.

"When they move out" you say joking.

"You wouldn't let them move out. You'll be looking after then when they're in their forties."

"Don't count on it." You say starting to leave. Sarah catches you in her arms and gives you a brief tender kiss.

"Love you" she says letting you go.

"Love you too" you reply, glad for the comfort before heading to dance.
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.title: After the wedding.

1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.content: Time has a funny way of passing quickly and even with three daughters to look after, the years fly by. A lot can change in a few years to and a lot does. Its hard to believe that your girls are now...
1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.title: Skip ahead.

1111321112222212121221121212211113211112.content:
11 years went by in the blink of an eye. Now all your girls are 17 and getting ready to finish high school and move onto going to the college of their choice. You are now in your mid 40's though thanks to realityshift.net, who has been you faithful friend over the years, you only look like you are in your late twenties with Sarah looking more she's in her early thirties. Without any help from your website, Sarah's company has grown massivly over the years, securing you and your daughters with a very good future. You remained a stay at home mom, taking the occasional modeling job for magazines when the girls started school properly. As for the girls themselves, they have grown so much over the years and all have matured into beautiful young women. The only problem is, the world has changed too and it is your opinion, not entirely for the better. With more and more men becoming women, the vast majority of the world's population becomes female. Those who have remained male are usually the rich or the strong such as big business men and sports stars. Some areas in Russian and the Middle East have held out however. The result of this is that lesbian relationships are now the most common romantic relationships in the world and since the chance of pregnancy in these relationships without a special piece of equipment is 0, girls are becoming more sexually aware younger now and having a girlfriend is a must for any teenage girl. You have put it in no uncertain terms that none of your daughters will even think about girl's in that way till college. Sarah thinks you are coming down too hard on them but you refuse to budge, this doesn't mean it isn't going on however.

Alexa https://66.media.tumblr.com/b95f657379a1... has shown herself to be something of an academic prodigy, excelling in all classes and mastering 3 instruments. You and Sarah are so proud of her accomplishments and can see her going very far. She is already writing here applications to several Ivy League universities who have expressed an interest in taking her on. Alexa is the most independent of all your daughters and while having a number of friends, she doesn't mind being alone and is not overly attached to any of them. She is by no means cold but just driven by her desire to succeed. You haven't had any problem with her trying to find a girlfriend.

Ellie http://cdn.pornpics.com/pics/2015-06-07/... has become, to your and Sarah's dismay, something of a tart. She flirts all the time and has developed something of a reputation at school. Despite this, Ellie is rather bright and is getting high grades in most of her subjects. You have though on occasion about changing her personality to make her more restrained, but you can't bring yourself to alter your daughter like that. Ellie still tries to act all cute to get out of trouble and still pesters her sister Sophia regularly but she is still in a close relationship with you, despite a few rocky years when she hit puberty. You are sure she has had girlfriends before although the most you have caught her doing is kissing one of her friends.

Sophia http://www.babemansion.com/wp-content/up... while not being as academically brilliant as her two sisters, makes up for it in her good nature and kindness. She truly does care for other's well-being more than her own and goes out of her way to help out with charities. She's worked for a time in charity shops, volunteered at homeless shelters and took part in every fund raising activity the school has ran. She is still something of a girly girl and is the your only daughter who kept up her dance lessons from childhood. She still has a rivalry with Ellie which flares up every now and then but for the most part they are civil. Your one concern about Sophia is her best friend Chloe http://images.eroticbeauties.net/cms/con... , one of your neighbor Gabriela and Helen's daughters. They have been best friends since since they were 5, going to the same school and taking the same classes. You think that they are becoming or already are more than best friends, judging by the way they look at each other and are always inseparable. Being honest, you wouldn't mind Sophia dating Chloe as they are both very trustworthy but that would then be unfair on your other daughters.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------------------------

It is a Thursday and you are picking up your daughters from school. You are sat in your car waiting for them to come out the gate. You tut to yourself as you see two girls start making out by against one of the buildings. http://galleries2.ftvcash.com/V20_gals/f... Its because of this that your daughters think your now dating rule is so unfair. Your eyes are torn from the spectacle as your doors open and your daughters get in. Alexa climbs in the front passenger seat while Ellie and Sophia climb in the back with Chloe in the middle. You give her lifts home since you live right next door.

"Hi mom" They all say.

"Hi Mrs. Bennett." Chloe says.

"Hi, girls. Good day?" You ask starting the engine.

"It was boring. Again" Alexa says. Being way ahead of everyone academically does have its disadvantages. "At least I finished one of my application letters."

"Mine was okay." Ellie says, checking her reflection in the window. "Got asked to go to the prom again." she hints. She had been doing this for months. Since you said no dating, this also meant no dates to the prom. Ellie was really upset by this and has made a big deal of it whenever she gets an invite from someone to be their date. On average she gets two to three invites a week.

"You keep saying that but every time I still don't believe anyone in the school has a strong enough stomach to ask you to be their date." Sophia says. This gets a small chuckle from Chloe.

"Shut it dweeb." Ellie says, flushing in anger. "Just, you're just happy since Chloe gets to take you as a date." She grins wickedly at this and both Sophia and Chloe blush, look at the floor and grow silent.

You don't press this as this is a common accusation but one that has never been backed up by any proof. Alexa just shakes her head and looks out the window.

"Its going to be a long drive." you think.
