As before, the memory is painful and doesn't want to be found but suddenly it comes to you and your eyes widen as you remember a lot about who you are and why you left.
111231.title: There are a few more things that have changed.

1112311.content: Was the relationship with a boy or with another girl.
1112311.title: You were forced to leave to end a relationship ...

11123112.content: yes, your parents are very conservative Japanese People and something like a lesbian relationship is not accepted in their world
11123112.title: With a girl.

1113.content:
As you click in the free text field, a speech bubble of instructional text pops up on the screen. "Enter desired change here." Staring around the mundane office, you give a wry grin. Desired change? This must be a joke.

I wish I didn't work in this damn place, you type and hit enter.

"BARNES!" Suddenly your boss is marching towards your table, his face red with fury. "PACK YOUR THINGS! YOU'RE FIRED!"

"Wh-what! Why?"

"HOW ABOUT SURFING THE NET ON COMPANY TIME?!" he bellows, jabbing a furious finger at your monitor, where RealityShift.Net is still open.

You find yourself shaking at the suddenness as you clear out desk. Fifteen years working your ass off for this company, and this was how they treat you. Fifteen years working with your colleagues, and now none of them will even make eye contact let alone talk to you. As you move to strip the family photos from around the monitor, your eyes fall on the web page, the blinking text box, and the words "Reality shift completed" beside it, and your brain begins to put two and two together.

Had the site done this? Setting aside the box, you decide it's worth a shot.
1113.title: Free text field or any of other options

choices: Take the Ipad and work out this website...
There's no reward without risk. Take the chance...
11131.content:
You didnt want to lose your job this quickly. Something had set your boss off on a bad side this morning which explained how you got fired so quickly.
Taking a chance, you type into the box.

'Keep my job'

Then you pressed enter. A loading box appeared and then an error occured.
"Error code 889x3652: Subject currently has no career ocupation. Most recent job ended at 9:01am (30 seconds ago)

"Thats werid - how could this program know I got fired only thirty seconds ago?' You thought. You decided to change what you had put into the dialogue box.
'Keep previous job'
Then you pressed enter. The same loading box came back up and there was an almost instantaneous flash of light which lasted nanoseconds. Turning around behind you, you saw your boss approaching from his office down the hallway so you quickly turned back to the dialog box.

"Complete"

Rather than risking losing your job twice in two minutes, you quickly lowered the program to the task bar.

"Here Mike" Your boss said, walking into your cubicle and not seeming to notice that you apparently no longer worked here. "The results from the new server installation. Apparently Gillette isnt satisfied with something or-... whatever. A little beyond my technical knowledge. She's given you a report to review and deal with"
"Uhh... thanks?" You said.

It must have worked. No way you would have gotten that report if you were actually fired three minutes ago.
"Just get it done as soon as possible. Our clients don't like being offline for so long" He said, walking out of the cubicle to go deal with someone else.

Quickly glancing at the report, Gillette wanted you to go fix the old network router in C-Block... a good five minutes away from your desk. You could take your Ipad with you and use the program remotely on your way over since you had internet on it, or you could stay in your cubicle and risk using it while in sight of your boss and other nosy co-workers.
11131.title: Unverified job removal application

111311.content:
Risking was too risky - especially here. You booted up your Ipad and quickly re-logged onto the reality changing website. Then you closed the web browser on your own computer and locked it. As a senior level networking manager at the company, nobody ever questioned - or checked - your internet usage. You had only been caught out by your boss because he actually saw it on your computer, something you luckily managed to revert.

Leaving the office block and walking to the far side of the complex, you looked at all the variations the website had to offer. It was broken down into various different sections which made a bit of sense. Unfortunately, there was no "Help" page for you to take advantage of. The main sections at the start broke into different categories called "People", "Objects" and "Other".

The "Other" Tab featured a plain simple textbox where you typed in what you wanted, practically the same as what you had used before. The "People" tab was designed to be used on people and typing in their full name made it far easier to change them. The objects tab was designed to be targeted at specific non-living objects and change them as you saw fit - including ways that didnt seem possible.

Perhaps now was the time to try out the "People" tab, or the "Objects" tab. What takes your fancy while your walking?
111311.title: Take the Ipad and work out this website...

choices: Subject and reality IS NOT aware of changes
Subject and reality IS aware of changes
1113111.content:
You decide to open the "People" Tab and see whats available, now able to read it more indepth than at your desk. The site however requested a targeted person.

Gina Turnville, a secretary at the compnay, passed by and you randomly typed her name in. Gina was secretary to one of the higher bosses that you never saw and, like nearly all of your co-workers, was sure that she got the job more for her looks than her qualifications which a quick internet check by Ross had shown up nothing.

Surprisingly, the website said that Gina was actually quite smart, but did confirm that her ability to get the job was based on 73% looks and 27% work history. Unusual average. Either way, you were gonna try something on her. You also noticed that a "Compare" tab appeared when you opened her page up. Pressing it, the website divided in half and allowed another person to be put in.

For the sake of it, you put your own name in. Your body appeared, fully clothed looking at an invisible objects in its hands (Obviously Ipad which the website did not render).

Before you could change anything though, a new window appeared:

"Thanks for trying the new comparison menu! This powerful tool makes it easier to copy physical and mental traits onto another person! However, we noticed there is a setting that you havent yet selected!

Two changes are option. Either the targetted subject (Not you) and the rest of reality can accept the changes as if nothing happened and life has always been that way despite any unnatural or illogical discrepencies, or they may be aware of changes happening to them as it happens.

[ ] Subject and reality IS NOT aware of changes.
[ ] Subject and reality IS aware of changes.
1113111.title: The power of the people tab

choices: Finalize it here and see how the world sees you now...
Keep making those changes to make the perfect you!
11131111.content:
You decided to go with the NOT AWARE option as it might allow you to have more fun in the long run of things.

The screen returned to the comparison of you and Gina. You noticed arrows beside each of the options that pointed to the centre. Accidentally pushing the face arrow on Gina, you suddenly saw that your own face on your model had changed. Looking at the reflection from the Ipad, you suddenly noticed that your own face had been replaced with Gina's, stitched in a rather ugly fashion on your male head. An undo option had appeared but you decided that for the sake of trying, you were going to push all the arrows.

All of a sudden, Tom, a senior network operator was now walking down the concrete path wearing black high heels, a formal black skirt that stopped at his knees and a white straightened shirt over his now female body which sported all the female appendages that came with it - including breasts. His entire head had reshaped to have Gina's long hair ginger hair which was tied back into a pony tail.

And to top it off, nobody even cared that Gina didnt even own an Ipad, or that she was walking into C-block to work on a busted network router. To make you feel even more giddy, you naturally sounded like her after a few quick tests. This website was insanely powerful - how the heck had you been given the opportunity to use it?

Walking into C-Block absentmindedly, Gillette approached you quickly.
"Didnt think you'd get here so quickly Tom" She said, walking up to you as if nothing had happened. Before you could say anything, she handed you a work report. "Router in the fridge has finally died."
"Fridge?" You asked, still surprised.
"Yea... you know... Sheesh, whats gotten into you today? You look confused or something. The fridge - its the room you named down in the basement because its always so freakin' cold in there because of the busted aircon unit"
"Oh yea" You said, suddenly remembering.

Nobody seemed to care that Gillette was talking to a young female secretary who wouldnt even step into this block because she never needed to come here.
"Get one of the new OE6 models and install it. Once your sure its working, I can install the new firmware and the boys upstairs who sign our paychecks can say that there are some happy clients out there..."

Gilette left you alone in what passed for a lobby in C-Block. Walking down to the basement stairwell, you stopped off at the warehouse to pick up a new network router. This website was insanely powerful.

Wanting to test the powers of the website even further, you went into the "Other" tab where you could type whatever you wanted.
"Stop time for everything except whatever gives me access to this website". Then you pressed enter.

All of a sudden... nothing happened. The website claimed it had happened but you didnt see just how much it HAD happened until you passed by the break room. Gillette was in there, staring at the microwave as something inside stood motionless. A man was pouring the last of his coffee down the sink, but the liquid itself had stopped in mid-air, not even touching the bottom of the sink. Clicking your fingers infront of Gillette, she didnt even blink and listening hard, she wasnt even breathing. Time had quite literally - stopped.

This was the perfect time for you. Quickly dealing with the busted router, you sat down in the breakroom filled with motionless people and got to work, learning more about the device.

"Create an inanimate clone of me five meters from where I am standing. The clone is a perfect replica of exactly how I look at any time and constantly updates whenever any changes are made to me. Destroy the clone when time unfreezes."

All of a sudden, a perfect clone of you - well, Gina - appeared in front, arms out wide and legs straight, looking at nothing with its eyes open. It was much easier to work off a mannequin like this rather than the rendering of the website which didnt work too well on your Ipad.

You decided to start with your height, making yourself a few inches taller, now standing just below the top of the door frame. Then you toned your muscles hugely which basically made you look like a tall, highly athletic Gina - something that didnt quite look right. You decided this needed to be fixed.
Starting with your hair, you made it black and shortened it to being a few millimeters above the skin while it ran from your shoulders and joined at your back. Then, the white business shirt which had been automatically adjusted to fit your body, was readjusted to show your midriff. You also adjusted your eye colour to be a deep red, something you hoped would be a useful intimidation tactic. After all, you deserved it.

Finally, the name Tom or Gina didnt seem like the sort of name that would fit with what was now a practically amazonian body. So you decided under the "mental" category, to change it to 'Athena'. Perfect. A greek goddess' names now being yours seemed to suit the amazonian body style.

Since this was an opportune time to learn about the mental section, you looked at the various other options. While you didnt want to mess with the personality section, you noticed that the "Mental' tab did cover alot of things, including job, job title, job description and job salary. For all the world cared, you could be Professional Performance Instructor with the job of Maintaining order in the company by being a shining example of how a woman should act and look. Of course, that would probably result all woman in trying to imitate your look so that didnt work.

You settled for keeping your current job title of Senior Network Administrator and then decided to increase your paygrade to $110,000 a year. Perfect.
11131111.title: Subject and reality IS NOT aware of changes

choices: Go to HR now... Oh great...
Stuff HR. Just delete Agatha from life and continue working...
111311111.content:
Your really interested to see how the world has changed now that you have a new name and body. Standing up and walking to the door in your new designer shoes, you type in "Unfreeze time" and suddenly the mannequin of you vanishes - everyone else also unfreezes as well - the coffee finishes pouring in the sink and Gillette's food in the microwave starts spinning again.

"All done" You call out as you leave.
"Thanks Athena!" Gillette calls back. You shiver slightly as she mentions your name - it's a name that commands power and respect, something you hope you can garner from this new body. Okay, so you had gone from being a man to a woman - Secretly you had always wondered what it would be like being a woman for a day and how often would this opportunity come up? Even if you only stay as a woman for a day, perhaps you might feel like staying like this - maybe it would be better.

Sitting back down in your cubicle on level 23 in E-Block, you notice that your family photos have changed. No longer is Tom smiling beside his mum, dad and sister - instead a happy Athena is with them, her height apparently quite evident in comparison to her parents. And now you were her, in all your shining glory. Anyway, enough of the day dreaming, time to start working and see how life has changed.

Not ten minutes into sorting out the new network software, you get a call from Agatha in HR. Oh great - you had never gotten along with Agatha. She was always trying to find the flaws in every single guy in this office block just so she could watch their sad faces as they walked out of the complex for the last time.

"Hello Athena, it's Agatha. You should come to my office right now if your free"
"Alright, whats up?" You asked, leaning back in your chair and looking down at your now highly attractive body.
"We'll discuss it in here"
111311111.title: Finalize it here and see how the world sees you...

choices: Find out whats going on with your mind - check that website!
Ignore it and move your stuff now.
1113111111.content:
You wonder if there should be any changes you should make before going to see Agatha, but decide against it, citing that you can deal with any problems after coming back. Heck, if she fired you somehow you could reverse that change almost instantly.

You lock your Ipad and hide it in your work bag, for fear that someone else could find it. Then you get up and start walking down to the HR office on the other side of the building, noticing a few eye movements as some men give you side glances that you would never have gotten when you came in this morning. Knocking on the office door, the croaking voice of Agatha called out for you to come in. She had you sit down in front of her desk.

If Agatha wanted to look down at you to feel intimidating - which she sometimes did due to raising her chair up - it would be completely impossible in this case. Since changing your body, you had increased your height substantially and now stood well over a head taller than her.
"Whats up?" You asked, relaxing in your chair.

"Your attire" Agatha said bluntly. "While you do dress to being within company standards, I am recieving several complaints that you are showing yourself off as being too attractive."
"Excuse me?" You cough. You really had no idea that the website would go into THIS much detail.
"Unfortunately, yes. And as per company policy after recieving a minimum number of individual complaints, I have to deal with this." She started.
'This is it' You thought 'I'm going to get fired for the second time in one day. Gonna have to reverse this again'
"I'm going to have to move your cubicle space to level 24 where there are less people. I'm hoping that the lack people up there will cause this problem to go away" She said, finishing.

You nearly screamed in delight, but held a straight face. Level 24 was an almost dream place for people in this building to work in. The company had long ago invested in some future proofing, adding some extra levels incase they needed them in the future as the company expanded. Level 23 had well over 100 employees working in it alone, between cubicles in the middle and offices along the walls.
Level 24 was set out almost exactly the same way, except that it had about 15 workers at the moment. The place was so silent it was a dream to work there. There was only the odd phone going off a few times a day, nothing like the constant phones here and the constant chattering, the occasional person going insane and the constant slamming of doors.

"Um... Thanks" You say, standing up.
"I'll let you move your own things - I know how much one can hate it when someone else touches their stuff" Agatha said, opening the door for you.

You leave the office and walk back to your cubicle, noticing the moving eyes again. This time you noticed that they were looking at your chest more than anything else.
'Perverts' You thought to yourself, laughing a little inside. Wait, where had that come from? You were a guy in your mind and should find it okay for guys to look at woman secretly. Was it possible that your mind was slowly adjusting to being a woman? That didnt feel entirely okay.
1113111111.title: Go to HR now... Oh great...

choices: See how easy it is to work here now...
11131111111.content:
This really unsettled you, so you decided to check the website and see if this was a normal process. Opening your Ipad back up, you went into the "Objects" tab and had your stuff all moved upstairs for you but didnt worry about changing reality - people could just think that you were a fast packer.

The website didnt have any sort of help file, so you wondered if the "Other" tab allowed questions. Already in the elevator to go up a floor, you typed into the "Other" tab the following:

"Does the Other Tab support questions?"

There was a brief loading screen and a new message appeared:
"Questions are still in BETA MODE but most questions should be available. If you intend to make any changes, do NOT format it as a question. Format it as a Statement. Otherwise the change is unlikely to occur.
Well, that was good enough for you.

"If I physically swap genders, will it affect my mind?"
"No physical swaps should affect a persons mind. However gender swapping tests have revealed over time that a subject's mind may slowly begin to alter to accomodate the new gender. This is considered a normal process and it is advised to allow it to remain happening. Subjects have not, however, completely changed - rather adjusted slightly."

Well that was refreshing. You werent going to completely change, just become an expert on walking in high heels. You soon found your new desk and sat down in front of it. You never needed to worry about being seen here. The only people who worked here were too busy on their own projects and the manager on this level spent most of his time asleep in his office. Someone always woke him though just so that he didnt get fired. It was a win-win situation. He kept the numbers on this level low and the employees stopped him from getting fired.
11131111111.title: Mind Changing effects...

choices: There's huge parts of this office complex you've never seen before... Explore!
111311111111.content:
Your about to get down to work when suddenly your feeling extremely hungry.

'Come to think of it, I didnt really have much for breakfast this morning' You thought. Either you could walk down to the cafeteria now and order something or you could whip up some more magic of that website.

Website it is.

You logged back onto the website, now citing just how much of your life it was about to improve again, when you thought to include some more stuff in the upgrade.
"Make it so that I don't need to eat or drink in order to survive. I am still able to eat and drink though. I never get ill or sick and am immune to all diseases and cannot get drunk regardless of how much alcohol I consume. My body will also never tire and I will not age. I will not get any wrinkles or blemishes. My skin will remain perfect. I also cannot get pregnant."

There was a brief loading screen.
"Complete" Was the response. Thankgoodness for that last addition.
All of a sudden, the hunger in your stomach died away. You could probably work here for hours and not notice it. Since you had the opportunity, thats exactly what you did.
Starting with what you were working on before, you finished upgrading the server software and worked on some reports and managing your calender for the next month. It quickly became filled with boring long meetings and client consultations as well as hours upon hours of work.
You had worked your butt off for this company and despite the now extremely high pay, the earned vacation hours never seemed to increase. Probably an HR thing...

After finishing up a last report sheet and checking on the new server software, all of which was fine, you noticed that the time was now 5:05pm.
'Time to finish work' You thought, closing down the computer, picking up your bag and heading to the elevator.
The elevator slowly crowded with people as it made its way down to the parking lot.
111311111111.title: Your feeling a little hungry.

choices: Make some interior and exterior upgrades to your house...
Go out for some fun in the town tonight...
1113111111112.content:
Just for now, you felt like heading home. The amount of work you had done today had ti-... No, you didn't get tired anymore. Such a werid feeling.

The elevator stopped at the parking lot and everyone slowly filed out in an organised group, not caring who got pushed and shoved to the side. They were tired and hungry and slightly bitter. The worst was on Friday, when everyone rushed out of the elevator eager to start their weekend which usually involved nothing productive.

You walked over to your car - a rusty, red, 1985 Toyota Corolla. You only had just enough funds to buy this car at the time - something that you really needed. Although it was really wrecked, at least it still worked and had actually only died once on you in the ten years you had owned it. Thank goodness for their legendary life expectency.

Except now you decided to change that. Pulling out your Ipad, the internet connection down here was a little weak due to all the concrete. However you managed to get onto the website and open the objects tab. Pulling up the profile of your car, you turned it into a Yamaha Goldwing, something that would really make the heads turn.

Getting onto the bike, you turned the engine on, listening to the beautiful purring as it waited to rush off. This bike was designed to go fast, not mill around in the backstreets of a city. Zooming out of the carpark and up the ramp, you felt the blast of air hit you and rush past your face. It felt amazing. When you hit the top of the ramp, you flew into the air for a few seconds, only to come straight back down and land perfectly, going out the parking gate onto the main road and zooming down the street.

You had no idea how to ride a motorcycle but apparently the website had modified you to know instinctively how to do it. You accellerated to 100mph and noticed a police car sitting on the side of the street. Just as soon as he saw you, he lost you, making this particular pursuit pointless. Only ten minutes later, you had arrived at home. Opening the garage door, you drove in and turned the motorbike off.

This was your home, an extremely small house with a single bedroom, a bathroom, kitchen and joint dining room and living room. The backyard occupied the same amount of space as your house so at least you had somewhere to do stuff outside. You might not have a second story but at least your house was on top of a hill which basically meant a free excellent view out the front over the ocean. This house was another one you got cheap, since realestate agents have extreme difficulty selling houses with only one bedroom.

Now that you thought about it, the toilet had become obsolete. Since you didnt need to eat and drink anymore, you didnt need to use the bathroom. Of course, if anyone did come over then they'd probably get worried over why there was no toilet, so you instead opted to keep the bathrrom the way it was.
1113111111112.title: Head home...

11131111111121.content:
Now in passion of the magic website Tom was thinking he would not have to continue that way of having fast food and cheap beer from cans. Also his whole apartment could need a makeover…..
So he went to the computer and started the edit mode for his home….
11131111111121.title: Make some interior and exterior upgrades to you...

11131111111122.content:
Despite the fact that you didn't actually need to eat anymore, you opted to at least treat yourself to some chocolate you had hidden stashed away. The food still tasted nice but you assumed that the website had somehow made a way to immediately destroy the food in your body, thus making the bathroom unneccecary. Probably heavily increased your stomach acidity or whatever.

Since tonight was Wednesday Night, that practically turned the local park into a market where hundreds of people came from around to buy food and cheap things. It was one of few tourist attractions in your town. You figured that down there at the market, you could have alot of fun, especially since it went very late into the night one market a couple of years back having to forcefully push a large number of people out at 4am.

The only problem was that you wouldnt have an internet connection down there. Sure, you had a phone, but a cheap one at that. Looking on the table, you noticed that you had left your Ipod there from the morning before you left for work. Picking it up, you stared at it intently, there must be a way to make this an effective tool. Then, suddenly the idea hit you, like a ton on bricks, only not so literally.

Logging onto the internet, you used the website to do some heavy modifications to your Ipod. First, you extended the battery capacity to beyond several years (The website didnt have an infinite feature... odd), then you made it so that it could access the internet at all times. Lastly, you transformed an old pie wrapper into thick leather case and strap which you then slotted the Ipod into, which fitted snugly attached to your arm. If anyone looked, they'd see an Ipod strapped to your left arm. Perfectly safe.

Getting back onto your motorbike, you zoomed out of the house (Locking it up prior to driving, obviously) and down the street to the market's which you could see had already started, down near the bay. If there was a breeze in the air, you couldnt feel it against your law-breaking speed. Stopping in the parking lot, you turned the bike off and headed into the markets. There were hundreds of things you could do here and money wasnt really an object anymore. Except buying things wasnt really what you were into - makin' some reality changes WAS...

Scanning the initial crowd at the edge of the markets didn't reveal anything interesting, so you decided to push forward through the throng of people and head inwards, to the centre, where there would be more people and more opportunities. Hey, maybe you'd even change yourself here if you found something you liked.

Reaching the centre, you once again looked around and found the perfect target for the start. Before you made any changes though, you felt like causing some chaos - some chaos on a front-page news worthy chaos level. So you modified the settings for your user on the website, making it so that when you made changes, people would be aware, even more so if it happened to them personally. Anyway, onto chaos creation.

A young couple across the path were making out, her long curly brown hair covering the side of her face against his black hair. Obviously both of them were rich, considering the clothing against what some of the vendors were selling. As a mediocre change, you switched their minds - and while nobody in the crowd noticed the change immediately, the girl suddenly became extremely aware of the lack of breasts, and the guy became very aware of his now extremely femmine hands. The couple broke their kiss in surprise and looked at their original bodies in surprise. Unable to take the shock, the guy (In the girls body) fainted almost immediately, his partner only just managing to catch him.

She was so frozen in fear at swapping bodies with her boyfriend that you decided to leave them as is.

Walking further through the market, you came across a mother and her highly intelligent teenage daughter. While her mother was an extremely ditzy blonde and the young girl appeared extremely intelligent, nobody would have made a family connection if not for the similair faces.
"Mum! Why can't I get this pad? Mathematics requires a 4mm grid workbook!" She complained.
"Because dear, I came for a beauty makeup. Now drop the book because you I wont let you buy it." Her mother replied.

That was almost too much for you. Vigoursly typing into your Ipod, you immediately switched a couple of the life roles with the two woman. The daughter immediately became the one in charge with the money and the life plans while her mother became an idiotic beauty obsesed complainer who never had money because she always wasted it or lost it. You left the group chuckling slightly.
11131111111122.title: Tonights Market night!

choices: Fully reject the idea and if leave nicely, don't change them...
111311111111221.content:
You continued walking through the market, looking at the various stalls and what they were selling. Ultimately, nothing really looked that interesting, just bits and baubles for the easily impressed.

Of course, you had slowed down immensely. You had noticed that two men with black hoodies had been tailing you for a while now. The first time you remember seeing them was just before the mother and daughter. Either way, their stalking techniques were pretty bad. Having become irritably bored with the market stalls, you left the market, hopped on your motorbike and headed home, very well aware of the two men in the car now tailing you at an extreme distance.

Whoever these hoodlums were, they didnt seem like the usual riffraff. Locking up the garage door, you waited in your bedroom for the oncoming door knock. Five minutes later, you saw the car lights appear outside the front of your small house. The lights dissappeared and two car doors slammed. Then, footsteps, slowly approaching the house. The men were cautious, afraid almost. Since your bedroom was on the road seeing side of the house, you observed them walk up. The taller man seemed hesitant to ring the bell, almost as if he knew he could be removed from reality at any moment.

The doorbell rang. Getting off from your bed, you walked out to the front door but before you opened it, you asked a simple question: "Who is it to come knocking on my door so late at night?"
"Potential work clients" The answer was, after a few seconds.

You opened the door slowly, almost ready to punch their faces if they tried anything.
"I am Kane and this is Joe. May we enter?"
"Why?" You asked, raising an eyebrow. Anyone would ask that at this time of night.
"Because, we have something to offer you"

You stepped out of the way and gestured for them to come in. They walked to the otherside of the dining table but didnt sit down.
"So, this 'offer' of yours" You said. "What is it?"
"Purpose" Kane said. You rolled your eyes, uninterested. He observed that well.

"We are aware of your device, 'Tom'. The device which allows you to physically alter the world around you. My associates would like your assistance in a few political matters" Joe said. It was evident that they actually knew very little of the device. Considering all your power actually stemmed from a website and that you could alter more than just physical things.
"I'm listening" You said slowly.
"You have had the device for only a short while and yet you demonstrate extreme understanding of its power. Yet this power may one day bore you - as there is no goal you cannot achieve without having to push a few simple buttons. We wish to give you a purpose by assisting us with your power"
111311111111221.title: Uh oh... Your being followed!

choices: they want to kill the president
1113111111112211.content: You kind of like what currently is happening, overall you see all of this as nothing more than a huge adventure or game. So now you play your role and ask Kane and Joe, what exactly they have in mind and how you could help them…
1113111111112211.title: Accept the idea... for now...

11131111111122111.content: what? You can not say that you like the current president, but killing him?
11131111111122111.title: they want to kill the president

choices: Keep walking around and messing with reality...
111311111111222.content:
You continued walking through the crowd, not caring about a single thing in the world while you had the ability to literally do almost anything you could think of.

Spying a young adult male with his wife, you decided to see if you could try something a little werid. Typing into your Ipod, the mans head suddenly sucked itself down into his body, yet everyone continued on as if nothing had happened. He still looked at the various stalls, apparently uninterested in most things, while his girlfriend spent ages looking at all the different cheap jewellery.

Working a little more crazy this time, you typed into the Ipod again. This time, the girl suddenly ripped her own head off and stuck it on the guys head, again noticing nothing.
The guy was still walking around as himself, doing his own things, although the girls head was still her own, on his body. Thus, making the girl headless and still walking around happily.
You almost fell over laughing at how silly the scene looked. Deciding to keep it that way, you moved on. Reaching the edge of the market, you turned around and headed back inside once more, your heels clicking on the pavement.

Spying a woman with shoulder length black hair, you typed into the Ipod again. All of a sudden, her legs and hips dissappeared and were replaced by the body of a black stallion. Her hooves clicked on the path as she walked, yet nobody had any problem with the fact that an actual, real life centaur had appeared out of nowhere.
111311111111222.title: Continue changing people...

choices: Possess someone just to see what its like...
1113111111112221.content:
Now, however, you had become bored. You had messed with enough people and you decided that it was time to go home.
Leaving the market and getting back on your motorbike, you zoomed through the traffic and quickly arrived at your house. Dumping the keys on the kitchen table, you laid down on top of your bed, keen to call it a day, ready for a good nights sleep.

Except you couldnt sleep. You didnt need to. You only just remembered that now. Darn, so many things to remember. On the plus side, you had the whole night to do whatever you wanted before you were "due" back at work the next day. You sat up on your bed and considered what werid and zany things you could do now.
1113111111112221.title: Get bored, go home...

choices: A perfect landing, your still moving...
Your sent sprawling back down to the ground, but your okay...
11131111111122211.content:
Sitting down in front of your computer, you wondered what it would be like to enter the internet - literally and physically. Logging onto the website, you began typing into your Ipod.

'I want to have a button strapped to my other arm in a similiar fashion to how my ipod is now. When I press it, I can go into the realm of the internet and when I press it again, I can leave'

The website took a considerable amount of time to process that request, but sure enough, a small red button on a strap appeared on your left arm. Keen to see what would happen, you pressed it.

Suddenly, there was a whirl of colours as you felt like your entire body - correction, your smoking hot body - was pulled into the computer screen and into the electronic circutry.
Awakening, you found yourself lying on what looked like a large metal electronic tube, with hundreds of blury objects flying at crazy speeds just above you. Lights flashed and glowed everywhere and there was an odd sense of complete cleanliness here. A wall terminal beside a door was to your left so you walked over to it, notcing the echo in your steps, and attempted to use it.

"Computer Name: Athena's Computer"
"IP: 192.123.4.567"

"REQUEST ENTRY" was higlighted in a flashing red button, as if you could press it. For the sake of it, you tried pushing it. The button depressed itself and the door opened.
Curious as to what was inside, you were about to walk in when a large object flew up in front of you.
"HALT" It said mechanically.
"ENTRY REQUEST DENIED
SUBJECT IDENTIFY"

You didn't know what to do.

"SUBJECT IDENTIFY OR FACE IMMEDIATE DELETION"
"I am Athena" You said. You looked closer at the object and suddenly realised that it was your own virus scanner that you had installed on your computer. This was amazing"
"SUBJECT UNKNOWN CLASSIFICATION. IDENTIFY CLASSIFICATION"
"I am a user"
"SUBJECT CLASSIFICATION DEEMED UNSAFE. LEAVE DEVICE IMMEDIATELY OR FACE DELETION"

You stepped back, seeing numerous objects sprout from the wall behind your virus scanner. Assuming that it was whatever it used to remove what it considered a virus, you let the scanner close the door and you let out a sigh of relief.
'Well, that was interesting' You thought. Looking up, the stream of strange and unfamiliar objects travelling at super speed continued. Doing your best to make out what they were, the best you could see was what looked like emails, photos and videos. There was a large number of others, but it didnt make any sense to you.

Wondering if the objects were solid (Whatever counts for solid inside the internet), you reached out your hand and jumped up. Something hit it and your hand, with your body, was sent smashed to the ground a few meters in front. Thankgoodness for making yourself invincible or you probably would have lost your hand entirely.

"I wonder if I could get on one of those" You said quietly, rubbing your head.

Suddenly, out the door to your computer, a small rectangular device appeared. Staying out of view of the other side of the door, you snuck up to it while it hovered a few feet off the ground.
The object had a marking on it.
"DESIGNATION: SCANTEC SERVER"
"SCAN RESULT: SUCCESSFUL"

The object was your virus scanners results from your computer. It slowly started to move away and you quickly jumped on top of it, clinging for dear life. The parcel rose to the rest of the crowd and shot off incredibly quickly. It sailed at the top of the tube, barely tilting with your weight. Once you had reached the speed of the other objects, you thought that it might be best to jump to something else before you entered Scantec's servers which was probably more locked down that the Alamo in terms of virus security.

Timing your jump carefully, you jumped off the parcel onto what looked like a giant envelope.
11131111111122211.title: Welcome to the digital world!

choices: Suddenly, your crate dives into a tube in the floor... Oh no!
The crate continues moving through the massive system...
111311111111222111.content:
Your landing was perfect. Keen to try it again rather than hit another virus scanner, you jumped onto another envelope, and another.

Unfortunately, your last jump missed the target and you were sent several layers down onto an unmarked grey rectangular box. It started speeding up, much faster than any of the other objects.
The tube turned suddenly, but the object that you clung to deviated and went into a much smaller tube, your head just a meter from the top.
The tube suddenly ended and you found yourself inside a massive, huge room with a single logo up the top in front of you, emblazonned with white lights.

"MICROSOFT"

'Wondered if I would ever end up here.' You thought. All sorts of electronic stuff was going everywhere, dividing into different paths and constantly changing speeds.

A big blue beam of light suddenly appeared up in front of you, a few large crates zoomed from your left to your right and the beam dissappeared.
111311111111222111.title: A perfect landing, your still moving...

choices: Continue the round and win it for the rebels...
1113111111112221111.content:
Before you could look around anymore, the slow moving crate suddenly dived into a tube in the ground, taking you with it. The tube was the same size as the one before, so you werent too worried about bumping your head.

The tube levelled out and the crate suddenly started to get faster and faster and faster - at least six times the speed of when you saw the other objects above you when you entered the internet. A logo rushed past you, but you didn't get a chance to read it becuase you were going so fast.

All of a sudden, you saw the tunnel end in an all too familiar white light. Rushing into it, you suddenly felt disorientated and nearly passed out.
The white suddenly faded and you crashed to the ground, sand inside a trench.

Carefully checking for broken or bruised bones, you stood up and looked at your surroundings. This place was all too familiar, yet you couldn't place it yet. Climbing a rusty ladder, you saw a massive metal blast door suddenly start lowering and a red flashing light appeared. An alarm was sounding. You didn't know what was going on, but if you were correct, you didn't want to be outside in the next thirty seconds.

Diving underneath the closing door, you hid in a dark corner of the room. The door closed and you heard a noise that sounded like several missiles going off. Then explosions.
Now you realised where you were, you had somehow entered a multiplayer map in Half Life Two: Deathmatch.

The alarm stopped and the door started to raise again. Walking outside, you saw several dead rebel bodies in the trench. Suddenly, heavy boots behind you and the sound of gunfire.
However, you invulnerability prevented any damage to your body. The combine soldier player kept firing and then stopped, as if he was confused. You looked at him and smiled. Whoever was on the other end of that controller was probably incredibly confused.
He walked up to you and then pulled out a stun baton, eager to try it. Repeated attempts at hitting you achieved nothing. The player stopped, backed up and then, obviously bored at what this glitch apparently was, ran away.

Going to the other side of the trench, you entered a small building.
"Got a microphone?" You asked. The rebel soldier you found turned to you.
"Are you the new model? Your hot" The player asked, the mouth disjointed in it's movement.
"Not really, just call me backup. Got a spare gun?"
"Are you hacking?" He asked. "How did you do that?"
"I'm not hacking"
"Whatever"
"Give me a gun"
"Can't drop guns"
"Then where's a spare one"

The rebel pointed his gun at a locker and sure enough, there was a pistol inside it. Picking it up, you checked the ammo clip, still full.
"Thanks. So, whats the score?"
"I'm not helping a hacker. I'll get in trouble"
"I'm not bloody hacking!" You yelled. The rebel soldier ran off.

You walked out of the room and spied an enemy soldier across the trench. Pointing the gun, you unleashed the full clip and he fell to the ground before he had a chance to retaliate. A string of swearwords soon followed from his dead body.
"Seriously... Too easy" You said.

Noticing that your clip was now empty, you pulled it out. Without any idea of how to actually reload, you just put it back in. Sure enough, you somehow had a full clip again. A battle had started on the far side of the map so you hurried over there and quickly shot all the enemies down.
"Hey, your good!" Another rebel said, a female.
"Thanks" You said.
"Are you the new skin?" She asked.
"No" You said, for the second time.
"This server doesnt have custom skins. Are you-"
"If you ask if I am hacking, I'll rip your head off and shove it down your bloodstained body. No, I am not hacking"
The emotionless face of the rebel was silent for a while
"You should take their gun" She said, walking up to it and looking at it.

Picking up the Combine Soldier's rifle, you reloaded the clip again (Magically, somehow) and proceeded inside the building. All of the soldiers had respawned again and you quickly threw a grenade in that you had picked up. They all exploded except for a lucky one who you mowed down with the rifle. Another string of swearwords followed, except also with the words "Hacker!" in them.

The other two rebels appeared behind you.
"How did you do that?" The girl asked.
"I threw a grenade"
"But you didn't die" She said.
"Hacker" The guy said. You turned and shot him. He'd respawn.
1113111111112221111.title: Suddenly, your crate dives into a tube in the f...

choices: Nah, leave her and continue on alone.
11131111111122211111.content:
The male rebel respawned and came up behind you. He unleashed a volley from his gun but it did nothing.
"Don't say it" You said, pointing your finger at him. No game had as much capabilities in a character that you currently possessed.
"So how did you do it?" The rebel girl asked.
"Do what?"
"Create a hot character and get into the game?"
"Long story. Whats the score?"
There was a few seconds pause. "We need twenty points to win" "They just need two"
"Seriously?" You asked. You had been in games with far worse odds and won. "Stay in here" You said. Walking to the terminal, you pushed the single button and the alarms suddenly went off again. The blast doors started closing and the enemy team was unable to enter.
"Nice" The rebel girl said.

You heard stun sticks on the doors again as the enemy team tried to hammer its way in. To no avail, the missiles fired and they were all killed.
"Great, just sixteen more points!" The rebel girl said.
"Can you do it for us?" The rebel guy said.
"Sure. That's easy. Just defend this spot" You instructed. The rebel girl did her best attempt at a nod by moving her gun up and down.

With your gun in hand, you left the safety of the building and proceeded to start mowing the enemy team down as they started respawning. A string of swearing entered the game as you constantly killed them when they spawned, giving them no chance to run and hide quickly. The battle was glorious and bloodthirsty.

Finally, the game finished with the rebel team winning forty points against thirty eight.
"All done" You said, They could leave the game whenever they wanted. The rebel guy didn't stick around but the girl came up to you.
"So how did you do it?" She asked.
"Do what?" You asked.
"Well, you obviously can't be playing a normal version of the game" She said.
"Well, no, I'm not"
"So what did you do?" She asked again.
"What if I told you that I was actually IN the game"
"What? No way"
"Believe it"
"Won't"
"Alright. I'm done here so I might as well go now"
"Wait" She said. "How are you in the game? I don't get it"

You pondered for a moment. Two options laid before you. Either you could reveal the secret of your device to this girl you had never met before or you could just leave her alone and move back into the internet highway.
11131111111122211111.title: Continue the round and win it for the rebels...

111311111111222111111.content:
A companion might be interesting, someone to give fresh ideas on what you could do with your newfound power.
"Alright, want to come into the game?" You asked.
"Yea!" She said.
"Anyone else around at your place?"
"No, home alone for a few days"

"Alright, go to the other side of the map and I'll make it happen." You instructed. She made another feeble attempt and nodding at left.
Typing into the ipod still attached to your wrist, you brought up and image of what the girl looked like. She looked about eighteen and had long black hair. She was tall, but not nearly as tall as you. She wore a dark green tanktop and some blue pants.

Continuing your work, you had the website suck the girl through her computer and into the game, replacing her in-game character.

A white light flashed in the distance and you ran over to inspect, sure enough, there was was with her gun in the world.
"Hey" You said.
"Whoa!" She replied, still trying to get used to everything. "What happened?"
"I used my power to pull you into the game" You said. "Except since the match ended, there's nobody left except us. So we can go elsewhere now."
"Where?" She asked.
"I dunno. I got here randomly" You said, taking her arm and leaving through a portal which had opened.

You found yourself back out in the big metal electronic tube, the same objects whizzing above you. This was alot for your new companion to take in.
"So, where are we going?" She asked.
111311111111222111111.title: Time for a companion...

choices: You exit the internet in an unfamiliar place...
1113111111112221111111.content:
"That way" You pointed to your left, the same direction as the moving information above you.
"Where does that go?" Your companion asked.
"No idea"

It was at this point that you realised that you didn't even know the name of your new companion. That was probably going to become quite an important thing in the oncoming days.
"So whats your name?" You asked. She turned to you.
"Jennifer Hale" She said.
"I'm Athena" You said. She seemed surprised.
"Strong name for a strong woman" She replied. You grinned.
"Nice isn't it? Ready to go?"
"Sure"

You grabbed her arm and then jumped onto a slow, low flying dark grey crate. It started speeding up as it rose higher through the mass.
"So where does this lead?" Jennifer asked over the noise of the movement.
"No idea. Should be fun though, randomness was how I ended up in that game we were in"
"Seriously? Because at the moment I'm pretty sure that I am hallucinating this, or I'm dreaming it all"
"It's all real" You said, sitting on the crate. Jennifer shaked her head, it was alot to take in.
"And this device here? It's how I do everything that I can do" You said, pointing to your Ipod firmly attached to your arm.
"And the red button?" Jennifer asked, pointing to your other arm.
"Let's me leave the internet, though where we will end up I don't know"
"Isn't that dangerous? What if we suddenly reappear on the other side of the planet?"
"You opted to come on this adventure" You laughed.
"I thought I was dreaming"
"Well, we all make life changing decisions every day."

The mass of information started to split off into different, smaller tubes. This was some sort of junction you had arrived at. Hundreds of different tubes spanned all through a massive room, each going to places you knew not of.
"So where are we going?" Jennifer asked again.
"No idea" You said again. "But I'd advise that we hang on tight"

Your words were perfectly on the mark. The crate you sat upon suddenly seperated from the larger mass and headed into a tube above you, suddenly going extremely fast - much faster than when you had entered the game of Half Life Two: Deathmatch. The speed increased and you noticed a multitude of seperating tubes around you, though your own crate stayed it's course, going straight ahead. The glowing lights of the tube around you slowly started to dim and eventually you and Jennifer were bathed in complete blackness. The only senses working for you two were the feeling of your hands gripping the fast moving crate and the wind (Which somehow exists here) rushing past your faces.

The crate began to slow down and you entered a very unfamiliar place. There were very few objects passing through here and looking down, there was a multitude of broken and destroyed objects below you. This looked like some sort of electronic dumping ground. Up ahead, some crates were being sent through what looked like a scanner. While the field they passed through mostly went green, allowing them to continue, the odd one or two went red, which resulted in the object immediately falling to the floor and no longer moving.
"Damn. This could be a problem" You murmured.
"That thing is safe, right?"
"I don't even know what that thing is so I can't really answer that" You said. "But I get the feeling that we aren't exactly on the party list of entrants."

Sure enough, when your crate went through, the field turned red and your crate was suddenly sent plummeting to the floor.
Upon impact, you and Jennifer were sent sprawling over the wreckage of many other discarded emails, crates and unrecognizeable objects.
"So what now?"
"You sure ask alot of questions" You said, pulling on Jennifer's hand and helping her up.
"I'm new to this"
"So am I" You laughed. "Maybe this is the time to exit the internet"
"Yea, maybe"
You took Jennifer's hand and pushed the red button.
1113111111112221111111.title: Heading left...

choices: Beef up Jennifer's invulnerability to near yours...
Traverse the wasteland, try to find a way out...
11131111111122211111111.content:
Nothing happened, no bright light, no flash of any sort. Here you two were, still standing on the wreckage in this dimly lit room.

The website displayed a new piece of information related to debugging.
"Subject is not near a computer terminal"

'Where am I?' You typed.
"Unknown location within INTERNET NEXUS"
'Teleport Jennifer and I back to my house'You typed. Nothing happened.
"ERROR CODE: 9877x54. Cannot teleport without base location to teleport from."
'Can I still use this website?' You typed.
"Functionality continues in reduced state"

You were in a deadzone, a place that the website had classified as non-existent. And if the website's power didn't work here, that was troubling indeed. Still, at least you wouldnt starve to death. Well, YOU wouldnt anyway.
11131111111122211111111.title: Nothing happens!

111311111111222111111111.content:
Although you would be okay, you had no idea if Jennifer was going to be able to survive in this absolute wasteland. Even if she didn't hurt herself, hunger and thirst would eventually build up and that might be a problem. Then she'd have to rest and sleep and do normal people things.

Normal People Things... The three words stuck in your mind as if it didn't sound right, sounded disconnected to you. Since the inception of this website into your life, you were probably further than normal for most people.

"Can we get out of here? I'm getting a little scared" Jennifer said.
"It is indeed a problem that we can't leave. So I'm going to have to modify your body a little bit"
"WHAT?" She asked in surprise. "How so?"
"Oh, just some general internal modifications... You won't notice a thing... yet" You said, waving her off. Jennifer peered over your shoulder as you sat down on a broken folder and began working.

First, you increased the strength of Jennifer dramatically, but also made a note that she lost all her boost when coming up against you. Then you made it so that she would never tire, or need to eat and drink. That would sort her out for a while.
"This might take a while. Let's start walking" You said, standing up as you finished. The changes were instantaneous. At least that still worked.

-----

Both of you trudged through the wasteland of broken internet stuff. The occasional crate flew above you but nothing substantial enough to get you out. Besides, plenty of things were coming in, but barely anything was leaving. After what felt like three hours, you reached the edge of this chamber, the glowing lights much dimmer in the walls than when you had first entered the internet.
"So, what, are we going to climb up or something?" Jennifer asked behind you.
"Something like that"

Typing into your Ipod, you modified your own hands and feet to make it so that they could grip firmly to any surface. Then, you pulled your high heels off. They wouldn't help you in this situation. Jennifer picked them up for you.
"Climb on my back, don't let you" You instructed. Jennifer did as she was told, although you barely felt her weight, as if she was nothing but a pencil. Your strength was indeed great.
Testing the grip on the flat of your hands, you were surprised to see how easily you could simply stick to the wall at will. Starting slowly but moving faster, you began to climb up the wall using your hands and your feet. It was difficult at first but you quickly adapted to this new style of movement. Eventually, you looked down, discovering yourself many meters above the ground.
"Don't look down" You said, making one last climb and hauling yourself and Jennifer into the tube you had last come out of.
"We can't get on these ones" Jennifer said. "They'll just take us through that device again and we'll be dropped to the ground again"
"I have an idea"
"Okay"

You had Jennifer listen for the sound of an oncoming crate and you flexed your hand. Timing yourself carefully, Jennifer nodded when she heard it in the distance. As soon as it was upon you, you punched it with all the force your enhanced body could afford.
The crate flexed and shattered into pieces, aside from a small device you hadn't seen before.
"Whats this?" Jennifer asked, picking it up.
"Our ticket out of here" You said, handling it. The small device was circular with a small rectangular block on it's side with ten small unmarked buttons. In the centre of the circle was a blue that flashed slowly.

Taking Jennifer's hand, you hoped for the best and pushed down on the light. Your theory was correct, this was what made everything here moved. The device, still in your hand, shot away down the other end of the tube, back from where you had come. Since it had no longer had a destination, it's movement was determined by where you aimed it, something that would probably have made for the most dangerous carnival ride in the history of the universe, considering your speed at the moment.

Eventually, you diverted from your tube and down another one, feeling like exploring a bit more before you left the internet. This tube glowed alot more brightly than any one you had seen before, except only five minutes later, you approached a dead-end. There were no moving objects in this large tube, only an end. There was a large door in the wall you could try and go through, or perhaps now you could try leaving the internet with Jennifer.
111311111111222111111111.title: Beef up Jennifer's invulnerability...

choices: Just in looks, not in powers or mind, change Jennifer into you...
1113111111112221111111111.content:
You dumped the movement device on the floor, it seemed to have burnt out. With Jennifer still attached to you, you decided that now was the perfect time to try leaving the internet.
Sure enough, there was a white light and you found yourself back in the real world. Except, now you were somewhere else. In a back alley. In an unfamiliar place.
"This isn't where I started" Jennifer said. "I don't recognise this place"
"Nor I" You murmured. Walking out from the alley to the dimly lit road, you looked around. Off in the distance, a well known greenish statue stood watch over the water, a great torch in it's hand and a crown on it's head.

"We're in New York" You laughed. Quite literally, the other side of the United States of America.
"We're so far from my home! How do we get back?"
"Don't worry, nobody will notice your gone" You said, still laughing.
"My parents will!"
"I can fix that"
"How?"
"Well, I'll just make it so that they think your travelling"
"Huh... How do you do that?"
"My little secret power"

"Alright, well since we are in New York, and it happens to be around Midnight, what are we going to do?"
"I'm going to enjoy myself" You said, putting your high heels back on and feeling how comfortable they were. "First I might go mess around with some bit's and pieces of reality, then, Oh, I don't know. I'll make it up as I go"

"Huh. Sounds good. Wait, you can modify bodies, right?" Jennifer asked.
"Yes"
"Can you make me a physical clone of you?"

The question astounded you. Jennifer wanted to look exactly like you, for reasons that were partially obvious. Since you were smoking hot, that was easy, but there wasnt anything too bad with her body.
"Why? Your perfectly okay as you are"
"I just want to know what it's like"
1113111111112221111111111.title: Try leaving the internet...

choices: Use the website to give yourself some money...
11131111111122211111111112.content:
"I guess I can do that" You say.
Leaning against a lamppost in the gloom of the night, you began typing into your Ipod on the website. The changes in Jennifer became apparent immediately as she rose in height and her clothes suddenly reformed into yours. Her hair shortened to the exact same length as yours and it kept it's shiny black colour. Jennifer's height increased yet again as her plain brown shoes reformed into black highheels. Her face bubbled and rippled until it reformed into yours and her breasts gained a few sizes.
Lastly, Jennifers eyes changed to the same deep shade of red as yours. If anyone looked at you two, it would be practically impossible for them to tell you apart, as even her voice had changed. The only thing she didn't have was a copy of your Ipod or the internet entering button which you also got rid of on yourself as you had no interest at the moment in returning to the internet.

"Whoa, this is amazing!" Jennifer said, now looking at her attractive, athletic body.
"'Course it's amazing" You said. 'It's my body."

Jennifer continued to look over all the angles of her body, admiring the phyisque you 'maintained'.
"Except I'd rather we make a few changes" You said. "So that I'm not constantly looking directly at myself."
"Like what sort of changes?" Jennifer asked. "If anything, I don't mind if I keep my old face and a different set of clothes."

You did just that, changing Jennifer's face back to her own, except making a few touchups. Then you dealt with her clothing, turning the top into a dark green tanktop with short sleeves and turning her short black dress into leather pants.
"Hows that?" You asked. Jennifer was shocked. Evidently she loved it.
"Thank you thank you thank you!" She yelled happily.

"Glad you enjoyed it. So, want to take a walk?"
"Sure!" Jennifer said eagerly. She was keen to get used to walking in her new form.

Both of you walked on the footpath beside the water. The fresh ocean air wafting across you inbetween the smog of the city. It was a mix of greatness and minor disgust. This was actually your first time in New York. Spying a still open pizzeria, you both opted to go inside and have some food. After having a whole two pizza's to herself, it was at this point that Jennifer realised that she still wasnt full.
"I don't get it. I could still eat just as much" She said, rather confused.
"Remember when I said I was making some changes back down in the wasteland in the internet?" You said. "You don't need to eat or drink to survive anymore, let alone sleep. While you can still do these things if you want, your not impared by it."

Jennifer looked at you, almost ready to disbelieve you if it wasnt for the adventure you had already been on. You picked up your glass of soda and poured the whole drink down your throat in one go. You could probably do the same with some beer, but for some reason your new body didn't seem to like the taste. Odd, it was something you might want to fix later.

"Well this is all great and everything, but I'm not sure how we can pay for all this. We don't exactly have any cash on us" Jennifer said. "My purse is back home"
Jennifer was right, you had no money.
11131111111122211111111112.title: Just in looks, not in powers or mind, change Je...

choices: Practise with you on Jennifer first...
Try it on a random passerby...
111311111111222111111111122.content:
"Perhaps we could try some invisibility?" You said with a sly smile.
"I'm not all for stealing but oh well" Jennifer said.

You went into both yours and Jennifer's profiles on the website and made it so that both of you were completely invisible to everyone except each other. There was a momentary flash as the website did it's job and suddenly the old guy behind the counter looked up in shock only to find two patrons suddenly gone... without paying.

He came over to the seats where you had been and shook his head angrily. Meanwhile, both you and Jennifer had sneakily gone right out the front door, banging it behind you. The man ran to the door and ran outside, looking up and down the street for you two. However, your total invisibility made it impossible for him to see.

Around the corner, Jennifer finally burst out laughing. "His face was so funny!" She said. You grinned and laughed a little before beginning to continue walking in the night.
"Hey, I had an idea" You said. "And I gotta admit, this IS pretty crazy"
"Yea?" Jennifer asked. After everything you had been through, anything was on the table now.
"What if we like, became someone's clothing?" You asked. "Just for a short while, and then the website would switch us back"

Jennifer looked at you with a sly smile on her face.
111311111111222111111111122.title: Try some invisibility...

choices: Someone jumps Jennifer from the shadows...
Remove yourself from Jennifer's body and have her try it on you...
1113111111112221111111111221.content:
"Alright, whose first?" Jennifer asked. "This sounds like fun!"
