'Okay?' You replied. There was a two minute pause.
'Can you come down here?' Jack asked.
'On my way... You alright?' You replied again. Jack didn't respond so you headed for the elevator and went down to the carpark.

You already knew what Jack's car looked like, so it was a simple matter of finding it and going up to the drivers window. Interestingly, however, rather than there being a man in his early thirties, there was a young woman with long dark brown hair tied back in a pony tail. Jack, or "Janette", winded the window down.
"Athena?" She asked.
"Yes."
"What happened to me?"
"Who are you?" You asked, jokingly.
"You won't believe me, but it's actually me, Jack. We were talking yesterday in the cafeteria."
"Oh, it's okay. I'm messing with you, I know who you are" You said, going round to the other side, opening the door and sitting in the passenger seat.
"What happened to me?" Jack asked again.
"Well, I can only guess it had something to do with our conversation yesterday"
"What?" He asked, confused. You stared at him.

"Did you do this?" He asked, looking at you.
"I may have had a small part in it, yes" You said nonchalantly.
"What the hell!" She said.
"Relax. It'll only last for the rest of the day and then you'll be back to your good 'ol self again. I see you took the clothes I gave you"
"These are yours?" He asked, picking at the white hoodie.
"Not really... Don't worry. Just go do your work as normal and nobody will care"
"I can't just walk in"
"I fixed that, yes you can"
"Really?"
"I dare you to try" You said, smirking.

Janette got out of the car and you followed suite.
"Thank goodness that I don't have anything important on today then" Janette said, locking the car and walking with you to the elevator.
"Mhm, lucky indeed. Nobody is going to recognise you here, but a few people know that your filling in for your male self today"
"They know that you transformed me?" She asked, surprised.
"No, they just know that a girl called Janette is filling in for Jack today"
"I'm not going to get used to that name" Janette said.
"Hm, I got used to mine" You said, walking out of the elevator, leaving Jack extremely surprised and wondering what the heck that was supposed to mean.

Once you settled Janette at her cubicle, you then headed back to the elevator, passing Gina in the aisle, who didn't notice whatsoever that there was an almost exact, yet more attractive, duplicate of hers walking past. Once you had settled back in your own cubicle, another message came through on your phone requesting your networking expertise at a meeting some floors down. Once again, you boarded the elevator and went down to level 15.

This was a particular level that you had never been to before, mostly due to the fact that you never had a reason for ever going here. Yet, here you were, coming to a meeting. The meeting room was apparently down the far end, so you walked through the cubicles, noticing the stares from many people as they had never seen someone like you before. While the woman didn't really seem to care (Or they didn't show it), the men seemed more open to prying than anyone else had been on level 23.

You knocked on the door and it opened for you.
"Ah! Athena, thanks for coming" A man in a suit said. You didn't recognise anyone here but took a seat down the far end of the table.
"We were just going over some implementation strategies for getting some radio towers operating at high altitude" He said, giving you some documents.
It was fairly rudamentary stuff which was probably going to be easy to work on.
"However, we don't know the most effective way of running cables up the mountains to the towers." He said. "Any ideas you have, we would be very open to hearing about."

You went over the documents and the topographical maps, using a pen to mark the best points for each section of cable.
"There, done" You said, after about five minutes. "Use some fiberoptic cabling to get them up there, as you'll need less booster units in order to maintain a clear signal"
11131111112211.title: "Janette" sends you a text from the car...

choices: Meet up with Janette and see how she is doing...
111311111122111.content:
You pull out your Ipad and bring up some relevant information concerning this apparent project. Fairly soon, everyone in the meeting room loses interest in you and begins to talk amongst themselves. Now that they were distracted, you could switch tabs in your internet browser and load up the reality changing website.

The room was filled with about six ordinary looking people, and you had some plans to change that. The website settings had been set to making it so that people were unaware of changes, which basically meant that you could do anything you wanted without consequences.

Firstly, you targeted the man who had called you in here, his name apparently being Terrence Workman. Going into the physical aspects menu, you transformed his entire body in that of a large ape. As his skin started to turn black and hairy, you noticed that his clothes vastly changed to accomodate his increased size.

Then, the two woman on the side looking over a document together, you merged both of their bodies, making them share a single body with two heads side by side. Looking at a woman with one head having long brown hair, and the other head having short black hair, was rather funny. Yet "her" clothes automatically adjusted to allowing for two necks.

Then, you targeted the man opposite them, who had not taken any interest in the meeting at all. First you completely removed his legs, only to replace them with about ten long red tentacles. He pushed his chair back out of the way in favour of standing on his own.

In the entirety of the room and outside, nobody seemed to notice or care about the rapid changes happening.
111311111122111.title: Makin' changes...

choices: Try being just a head with attached tentacles...
Try the whole head transport thing again...
1113111111221111.content:
A young girl came into the room and handed a document to Terrence for him to sign.

Thinking quickly, you made a quick change to the girl, who's name was apparently Miranda Evans. Her head suddenly began to sink right down into her body, hair and everything, leaving nothing but a skin covered neck stump. Despite this however, she happily stood there waiting for Terrence to finish reading whatever it was she had handed him.

Deciding to try something a little new, you set a timer for this next transformation, making it only last ten minutes before reverting yourself back to normal and returning you to your cubicle.
Unaware of her actions, Miranda came over to you, picked you up by your head and put your head down on her neck stump. When you were lifted, your entire body was sucked into your head, leaving you as a bodiless woman who's head was attached, but not in control, of another woman. Meanwhile, everyone continued with what they were doing.

Miranda took the document and left the room, then entered the elevator and went down to level 12 where she returned to her own cubicle and started doing some filing. The experience was uncanny, Miranda seemed to find it normal that she had no head, and that there was another person's head attached where her own would be. You find the trip quite enjoyable, as you "laid" back and enjoyed the ride. Your head felt like it was properly attached though, so you didn't need to worry about rolling away or anything.

However, ten minutes was quickly up and the website reverted you back to your own body, in your own cubicle up several levels, with the Ipad safely in hand...
1113111111221111.title: Your own human taxi service...

choices: Continue as a head with tentacles...
11131111112211111.content:
Wanting to test the boundaries of your own transformations even further, you log back into the website on your Ipad.

Your previous save was still in the memory, but you removed the time limit and set it so that as soon as you willed to be returned to normal, you would do so. Going into the "Body" section, you completely removed it, leaving you as just a head. However, before you made the physical changes, you utilized the website to sprout six light red two meter tentacles.

The changes were almost instantaneous, and you felt your own body being sucked into your head as your vision began to lower to the ground. Then, only two seconds later, the tentacles began to sprout out from your head, flailing onto the ground as they grew.
Controlling your new tentacles wasnt something that came easy. Previously, you had been accustomed to the usage of two arms and two legs, yet now you felt like you had an extra set to try and learn how to use. It took a while, but eventually you managed to gain control of each tentacle, and begin moving around the office floor.

Nobody noticed you as they passed, so you quickly took the elevator down to level 23 by pushing the buttons with the squishy end of your tentacle. Still, nobody noticed you, it was as if you had completely dropped off the face of the earth as far as some people were concerned. You passed by Janettes cubicle, and she seemed to be doing alright, though you noticed that she was looking down more often than she did as a man.

Passing by more cubicles, you latched onto someone's back and went for a joyride. Though you didn't recognise the man in question, the ride was brief and you quickly jumped over to another person going in the opposite direction.

While this was interesting as first, you quickly found yourself becoming bored with this new body, longing for your female physique to return.
11131111112211111.title: Try being just a head with attached tentacles...

choices: Check out the Memory Alteration section...
Check out the Mass Transportation section...
111311111122111111.content:
Finding a quiet spot, you quietly returned to the form of your female body, losing the tentacles and gaining arms and legs back along with your clothes.

Leaving the empty cubicle you had used to change in, you headed back for the elevator and went back to your desk, interested in seeing what else this website had to offer.

Two features that you hadnt previously noticed were available off to the side, so you took a brief look at them. The first one was simply titled "Memory Alteration"... whatever that was supposed to mean, and the other was labelled "Mass Transportation"

Both looked interesting and you could guess what Mass Transportation meant.
111311111122111111.title: Return to your normal body...

choices: Jack takes an unusually long time...
1113111111221111112.content:
You opened up the Mass Transportation section and were greeted by an interrupting dialog message.

"Welcome to the Mass Transportation section! This feature is still in beta but it's nearly done and your welcome to test it out. You can transport as many people as you want to any location in the universe just by typing their names and then typing the location. Or, you can have the website randomly select people from the world based on your selected preferences. Mass Transportation can also be used to transport people to a previously uncreated world which you can also build by typing in the information to as much detail as you desire!


"Whoa, this could be awesome..." You thought.

A rather sly thought entered your head and you wondered if it was possible. Checking the clock on your computer, you had a few hours before anything worthwhile was going to happen, so you began with the preferences.

The website would randomly pick fifty thousand people from around the world based on several different requirements; They had to be
- Within an age range of 18 to 30
- Healthy
- Able to speak English
- Currently awake.

Otherwise, it was all up to chance.

Then, you set out the parameters of your new world. This was going to be amazing. The entire process actually took over two hours, while you delicately fine tuned the parameters of your world. You had no idea if the website could actually do this, but here's hoping that it would be good. Finally, nearly three hours later, you txted Janette to come up to your cubicle. She arrived shortly.

"Everything's about to change" You said with a sly smile. She tilted her head.
"Does that mean I'll be changing back? Because this is just too werid"
"That's not all" You said.

Just as you said that, you pushed "Apply" on the website. A white light blinded you as the world melted into nothing.

-----

Cold white stone beneath you was what you first felt when you awoke. Opening your eyes, Janette had turned back into Jack and was also only just waking up.

Standing up, there were hundreds - no, thousands of people around you, all slowly waking up and wondering what had happened. A short distance away, a figure floated down from the ceiling about a hundred meters above you and came to stand upon a podium about four hundred meters away. Everyone eventually came to their senses and began to ask what the heck had just happened.

"WELCOME CONTESTANTS!" Boomed the voice. Male, deep voice. Everyone turned.
Several images flickered into view around the ancient looking stadium, giving a much better view of the man. He was pale with razor sharp short black hair and adorned in black armor with a multitude of engravings and patterns.

"You have all been specially picked and transported from your world to take part in the greatest challenge yet to space humanity! In this world, you can rely only on your Geas, the device strapped to your arm! If you survive the terrors of this world, both inhuman and human, then you may eventually rise to be champion. Only when the great Demon Lord of Ozaharo is defeated can you return to your world! However, be warned. Death here means death on Earth!"

There was a momentary stunned silence as the man rose back up into the ceiling. Then the entire crowd went into a mass panic. Jack turned to you.
"Seriously?" He asked, a mix of surprise and horror with a hint of interest.
"Figured, why not" You said, shrugging your shoulders and attempting to make yourself heard over the crowd. Everyone had been transported here in their usual attire, but without and belongings including watches, keys, wallets and the like. The only thing everyone owned now was the clothes they wore, and the unremovable device on their right arm (Though they could change the arm it was attached to if they wanted)

"The smart people will be the one's who survive" You say to Jack, leading him away from the panicing crowd and outside. You were standing on a large balcony, overlooking a massive forest down below.
"Well, obviously. But I suspect the rules here are different"
"Indeed. You ever do much gaming before?"
"Yea, plenty... Why?"
"Health and Stamina. Both are equally important. Look at your device, red is health, green is stamina. If your stamina is low or gone, your tired. But it will come back. If your Health is low..."
"I think I get the picture" He said, looking at his device.
"These clothes won't provide much protection. We'll need to find something more effective"
"How? I mean, we can't just go and dig a mine, find some ore, smelt it and then make some armor... Can we?"
"Well, at the moment, no. But what we can do is go hunt in the forest. Food is equally important"
"Oh great"
"Yup"

"So what's the plan?"
"This isn't a regular game." You explained. "Assume the difficulty is on hard, well, 'insane' is a more realistic term. Poison is deadly, getting can kill, that sort of thing"
"Then we'll need to stick together." Jack said.
"Yea, but the survivors of the first few days are gonna begin to band together. Some of the people here aren't exactly... Well... friendly" You said.
"You picked everyone?" Jack asked in disbelief.
"No, it was random. Aside from you and me." You said, turning to lean on the balcony railing and look into the crowd. "Go in there, find someone who can't protect themselves or looks worthwhile and bring them to me"
"Why won't you do it?" Jack asked.

"I built this world according to parameters, not hand for hand. I know what to expect, but I don't know the full layout. I need to work out what I have done"
Jack nodded and headed into the crowd.
1113111111221111112.title: Check out the Mass Transportation section...

11131111112211111121.content:
About twenty minutes later, the crowd's panic had subsided and a large number of people had moved off. However, you were correct in that they began to form into groups. The head usually being the person who had the biggest muscles. Bah. Muscle wasnt everything here.

Jack came back shortly with three people, making your party five in total. He quickly introduced the young girl as Sasha, the bigger muscle rippling man as Frank and the very wiry boy called Simon.

"These two already seem to like you. But I will decide on whether or not to join you based on what you offer" Frank said in a deep russian accent, folding his arms and refusing to come outside. It sounded fair.

"Here's the facts. People are very quickly going to form into groups. Though knowing human nature, it's likely the head honcho's will be the person with the thickest heads. I'm not the strongest person here (Well, that's was an obvious lie thanks to the website, but nobody knew that) but I can think. I want to survive this as honourably as possible. Now, maybe that means defeat, but I'd rather die knowing I did right than making everyone hate me."

Frank stared down into your eyes, unmoving. "Your group is small" He said.
"Thus making each mouth easier to feed and each person easier to keep track of. Would you rather keep track of one hundred people or just four?" Jack said.

Frank nodded, smiling. "I think I like you as well then. I shall be glad to lend my arm to you. What is your name?"
"Athena. And it's excellent you decided to join us." You said. "I wouldnt be surprised if this place turns into a bloodbath soon. Let's get out of here."

You quickly found the main entrance and began heading down the massive steps into the forest.
"Any idea what to expect?" Sasha asked. "I've played alotta games in the past and something tells me this forest isnt full of rabbits and foxes"
"What would you expect it to be full of?" You asked.
"Wolves... Trolls, balverines... Anything that might want to eat us."
"Bandits?" Frank asked.
"The only bandits I think we will encounter will be other players"
"Then we must strike first, before they get the upper hand" Simon said.

You walked for a full thirty minutes before anything happened. A few meters away, there was some rustling in some bushes, then a low growl. A small dark figure pounced onto Sasha, who squealed in surprise. Frank, however, was quick on the mark and smashed the ambushers head into a tree. The wolf fell to the ground, dead.

Almost immediately, your group was surrounded by savage, starving wolves who jumped into the fray. Each one of you had at least three wolves to fight off alone, but Frank seemed to be taking most of them, kicking off at least ten.
You concentrated on your own pack for now, giving them sharp kicks and punches where possible, sending them sprawling and dead. Sasha and Simon were struggling on their own, so you quickly jumped in and helped them. Frank, meanwhile, had dealt with his bunch and proceeded to help Jack.

The fight was over in a matter of minutes and everyone stopped to restore their stamina.
"That was... interesting" Simon said.
"Pick up as many as you can. Let's find a clearing"
"Why?" Jack asked.
"Nobody's gonna pay for anything here with money. But we do have food and we can start a fire"
"My father taught me how to hunt wolves. I shall gut them" Frank said in his almost arousing accent.

A few minutes later, you stumbled across a clearing and set down the dead wolves. Both you and Jack began to look for some good burnable wood while Frank happily tore into the wolves with his bare hands. Sasha looked away. Shortly after, the meat was roasting over the fire and Frank was busy doing something with the skins.
"Is there any water nearby?" He asked.
"A river just down the hill there, not one minute away" You said.
"Come little one, I shall teach you" Frank said, taking Sasha with him.
11131111112211111121.title: Jack is back shortly...

choices: Make this clearing your base of operations...
Move on into the forest to continue hunting.
111311111122111111211.content:
Frank was back rather quickly with a surprised look on his face. In his and Sasha's hands were perfectly crafted pieces of leather.
"We just washed the skins and started removing the hairs and it just... well... transformed" Sasha said.
"Really?" Jack asked, eyeing you. You werent actually expecting that.
"Yea, only took a minute to happen" She said. "Should we take the rest of the skins and do it?"
"Sure" You replied.

Sasha handed her pieces of leather to you and took some more skins. You proceeded to lay them on the grass and think.
"They just transformed... huh?" Jack asked you in disbelief, obviously suspecting you of interfering.
"It's a game, not reality as we know it" You said. "That being, I'm going to try something."

You ripped proceeded to move around the pieces of leather, ripping off a few pieces to turn into strips. Only a few minutes later and you had designed a small vest which suddenly flashed in white light and then transformed into a proper stitched leather vest.
"Hey, now that's cool" Jack said, surprised.
"Here, try it on" You said, passing it to him. Jack put the vest over him and tightened the straps while you and Simon watched. It fitted him quite well.
"I like it. Mind if I keep it?" Jack asked.
"Go ahead. I'll fashion some for everyone."

Frank and Sasha returned soon with more leather and you prepared the new vests for everyone. Unfortunately, there wasnt enough leather for everyone, so you decided to be nice and leave yourself out.
"Hey, this is new" Sasha said, tapping on her device on her arm.
"What's new?" Simon asked.
"A new thing appeared... 'Armor Rating: 5'"
"That's quite small" Frank replied.
"Maybe, either way, it's better than none"
111311111122111111211.title: Frank comes back shortly...

1113111111221111112111.content:
You all sat around the makeshift campfire that kept burning.
"So, what now?" Jack asked. There was a momentary silence.
"Well, I'd like to setup this place as a sort of base" You said. "It's a fairly good clearing"

"What about wolves and stuff?" Sasha asked with moderate concern. "I'm apparently sitting on 90 health since the attack and it hasnt gone back up"
"Tried eating?" You asked, raising an eyebrow.
"No"
"Try that"

Sasha ripped into a piece of wolfmeat that was roasting over the fire.
"So, I figure we cut down the trees-" You said.
"-with what?" Simon asked.
"I was just getting to that. We cut them down with something like an that we can craft and build a small shelter"
"Alright, where do we get an axe from?"
"Frank?" You asked.

Frank pulled out a sharp rock he had found down at the stream and tossed it to you. The rock was arrow shaped with a single sharp point, almost perfectly shaped. You found a good stick and wrapped the rock in place. Almost immediately, it flashed and turned into a properly made axe.
"We need to start experimenting." You said as everyone looked in surprise. "If you think you can make it, you probably can. You just need the parts"

Passing the axe to Frank, he nodded thankfully and proceeded to cut away at a tree.

-----

The next few hours went almost like clockwork. Frank cut down several trees, which almost magically lost their smaller branches and split down the middle perfectly. Simon fashioned a shovel out of a large flat stone and a bigger branch, which you proceeded to use to dig a small trench in ground as groundwork for the shack. Jack and Sasha began fashioning various stone tools down at the stream, and returned with some handy stuff.
"You've been busy" He commented.
"So have you" You replied.
"Just wait, I'm not done yet. Got a good branch that I can use?"
"Here" You said, picking up a nice straight branch off the ground that fitted nicely in your hand. Jack and Sasha returned to the stream.

Fairly soon, the shack was complete. With a leaning roof and four walls, it actually didn't look that bad. Admittedly it didn't have any nails to keep it together, but one of Jack's tools was like a carving knife, which went through the wood like butter. As such, you managed to find a way to slot the pieces together.

About ten minutes later, Jack returned, hauling something heavy with him.
"Gimmie a hand?" He called out.
"Whats this?" You asked in surprise. It looked like a massive hammer, the wood cut smooth and a large stone on the end which was oval shaped with a flattened end.
"Yo, Frank. Take this"

Frank came over and hefted the tool. "I like this very much"
"Consider it a present. Took me a while to build"
"I shall carry this weapon with pride" He beamed. You looked at Jack with an eyebrow raised.
"We'll need weapons" He said. "And since we can't make bows, thats pointless. And I'd rather make swords and the like out of proper metal. But I figure that Frank would have no problem defending us with that massive hammer"

Jack had made a fair point. You nodded in agreement and he returned to the stream.

-----

After a short discussion, Frank began increasing the size of the clearing and with Simons help, you managed to create an impressive fort out of wood, the total size being the equivalent of two houses. Admittedly, the main entrance didn't have any doors but you could soon fix that. The shack had been vastly improved, up to a whole second story and some makeshift beds had been crafted by Frank, who also hunted out some more wolves whose pelts could be used to soften the beds.

"This is impressive" Simon said happily as everyone admired the days handiwork. The sun had began to set on the horizon and you were moderately concerned by the fact that you hadn't actually seen anyone else in the whole day.
1113111111221111112111.title: Make this clearing your base of operations...

choices: Everyone's keen to do some mining...
Surprisingly enough, nobody's keen to get into a fight today...
11131111112211111121111.content:
It was finally time to use the website again, which you thankfully had access to on your arm device. Jack was in his bed opposite you, staring intently.

"So what happened?" He whispered. Everyone else had already fallen asleep.
"Mhm?" You asked.
"We didn't see anyone today"
"I'll check the game stats"

The website had created a seperate program just for you which allowed you to check on every single aspect of the game and change anything you wanted whenever you wanted. Of course, physically or mentally changing a real person was still up to the original website. You loaded up the stats and were surprised by what had happened over the course of the day.

"We started with 50,000 people, right?" You said to Jack.
"Yes"
"Down to 48,873 contestants" You said grimly. "After we left, a few wars broke out and there's also things in this land more dangerous than wolves."
"Evidently. So how come nobody has found us"

You pushed a few buttons and the information turned into a map of the game boundaries. Red blips showed where people were, larger blips for an increased number of people.
"We're actually quite alone out here. There's a few stragglers less than a kilometer away but the larger groups have actually gone in the opposite direction"
"Well thats fortunate." Jack replied.

Fortunate or not, your position wasnt actually entirely ideal. A topological map indicated that there was little to no ore in the surrounding area. Well, that just wouldnt do. There was large mountain not too far dotted with large cliffs. You proceeded add a small encampment to the cliff that was infested with enemies. Fortunately though, the first one there would enjoy the spoils of having access to a moderate length cave filled with high quality ore.
You decided to call it a night and go to sleep, wondering if everyone would be keen to go for an easy battle tomorrow...
11131111112211111121111.title: Check on the remaining numbers

choices: A surprise attack in the night!
111311111122111111211111.content:
Breakfast in the morning consisted of wolf meat (Which had continued to roast over the fire that never went out, and the meat hadnt burned or gone off either) and fish from the stream (Oddly, none of which contained bones when cooked)

"So, I have a confession to make" You said. Everyone turned up to you. "I know we are meant to stick together, but I did some scouting last night because I couldnt sleep"
Jack immediately knew you were lying, but kept to himself, probably smiling inside because he figured that whatever you had done would be to the benefit of the group anyway.

"What did you find?" Sasha asked.
You pointed in the direction of the mountain.
"Five to ten minutes that way, there's a cave being guarded by some sort of impish creatures. I'm fairly certain that there's some quality ore in there"
"Oh?" Simon asked, looking up.
"Keen for a fight?" You asked.

"My hammer is always ready" Frank said with a wolfish grin. Sasha nodded happily and so did Jack.
"I'll stay here and guard the camp then" Simon said, shrugging his shoulders. "Who knows, maybe I could make some improvements for when you get back"
"You sure about that?" You asked in surprise.
"Yea, I'm good at building stuff, not at fighting"
"This is a game, everyone can fight"
"Still"
You held your hand up to stop him continuing. If Simon wanted to stay, who were you to stop him?

"Alright then, might as well go now then" Jack said.

-----

Only ten minutes later, Frank, Jack, Sasha and you were hiding in the bushes a short distance from the enemy camp. The creatures there looked like small goblins, but were blue in colour... and far uglier. Jack had brought an axe with him and Sasha had a hammer. You, on the other hand, decided to just use whatever was lying around in the enemy camp.
"We can't really jump them or anything, we don't have the tools for that yet" You said quietly. "I suggest that we just... run in there weapons blazing."

Frank and Jack didn't wait to argue, they charged in with their weapons brandished, smacking down two of the creatures before they could do anything. You and Sasha just shook your heads and charged after them.
One of the creatures was riding what looked like a boar, his pitiful wooden stake completely missed Frank as he charged. Meanwhile, Frank brought the fury of his hammer around to smack the boar, sending both enemies sprawling several meters away.

The battle was over in about a minute.
"Great, let's get inside" You said, finding two pickaxes and giving one to Frank, the other you kept for yourself.

-----

The cave was dimly lit by several torches that also appeared to never run out. Frank found what appeared to be a vein of ore and began to break small chunks out of it. Jack, with a keen eye for rocks, identified it as iron.
"Could be very useful" He said.

Meanwhile, you were scouting for something more valuable. RIght down deep in the mine, you found it. An ore vein unlike the others. The ore in it had a dim blue colour and you gently coaxed it from the dirt and rock.
"Yo! Someone get down here and help me with this!" You yelled back up the tunnel. Sasha and Jack eventually arrived and you handed them several chunks of ore"
"What the hell is this?" Jack asked. "I don't recognise it"
"Probably because you'll only find this in the game" You said. "And I suspect it's rare.

The vein promptly ended after about two meters and you helped them haul the rare ore out of the cave.
Frank had found a ramshackle cart owned by the previous occupants of the mine and had loaded it up with a large stack of iron ore.
"There is much iron in this mine!" He beamed. "I shall have to return to get more after this load!"
"Sure thing" You said, shifting the weight of the ore in your hands.
"What is this?" He asked, picking up a chunk.
"I don't have a name for it yet"

"Stalhrim?" Sasha asked innocently. Frank stifled a laugh. Both of you immediately understood the reference.
"Stalhrim it is then" You said, smiling.

-----

After a bit of work, the ore was returned to your camp. Simon hadnt sat on his bottom the whole time, and had actually spent it building a fairly basic forge using various stones.
"It's not perfect, but it should work" He said. You all admired the handiwork.
"Thanks Simon, It's perfect."

Simon busied himself helping everyone else move the iron from the mine to the camp. You, on the other hand, began to work the forge and reshape the stalhrim ore. Every once in a while, someone came over to observe, but nobody spoke to you. This required quite a bit of concentration.

Finally, after many hours, you admired your handiwork and brought it over to show everyone else.
"First, I present this to you" You said, giving a Stalhrim longsword to Jack. "It's fairly sharp, so be careful. Then, to Simon, this axe"
The axe you gave Simon was far better than the first one that Jack had made. You spent a short while doing some basic carvings into the weapon and it's handle was wrapped in leather straps to give a better hold.
"For you" You said to Sasha, giving her a spear. The tip was made of Stalhrim and was the sharpest of any weapon you had made. Although it appeared to be made of wood, the core was Stalhrim and it was also wrapped in leather to help with grip.

To Frank, you gave a much better hammer. It was very similar to his original, but the stone head had been completely replaced by Stalhrim and was less smooth. The flat edge was also roughened to improve the damage.

Lastly, for yourself, you had fashioned a unique set of armor and a longsword with an iron rimmed heater shield, all of which was made of Stalhrim. Admittedly, the armor was a little revealing. The armor composed itself of thick shoulder guards and a chest piece which came down to show the lower half of your midriff. The leggings almost fully covered you, excluding the top half of your legs. The gloves were quite light, and came up to your elbows. Finally, the helmet looked like a medieval Barbute. The entire armor though, was underlayed with leather to make it more comfortable.

"I can't tell if your intentionally trying to be revealing" Jack smirked. Everyone else stared in wonder when you put it on and showed them.
"I actually kinda like it" Sasha said.
"Whats the rating?" Simon asked. You checked your arm device.
"Armor rating is two hundred and the weapon rating is ninety"

Everyone else checked their own weapons and found similar weapon stats.
"Why do I get the feeling that we may have just gone and found endgame gear?" Jack asked.
"Well, maybe. Either way, thats the last of the Stalhrim. Oh, and one other thing. I used my arm device to lock the weapons and my armor. We can't trade it or use anyone elses gear. So there's no point in anyone even stealing the gear as it would be worthless.
"That is good" Frank said.

"Hey, this is interesting" Frank said, pushing some buttons on his arm device.
"What did you find?" Sasha asked.
"Well, I don't know if you can see it, but for me, your all glowing"
"What?" You asked.
"Yea. Apparently I can turn on a feature that lets me know how strong you all are in comparison to me. All of you are yellow, probably because of the weapons. But Athena, your a very deep strong shade of red. Have a look at your arm device."

Surely enough, the feature was available to everyone.
"That's going to be handy to know in the future" You said.
"Well, it's bordering on evening, how about we call it a night?" Simon asked. You all nodded and headed for bed.
111311111122111111211111.title: Everyone's keen to do some mining...

choices: Another group has arrived at your camp...
Study the Ruby on the way back...
1113111111221111112111111.content:
The night passed uneventfully and you woke up in the morning feeling refreshed, or at least, the equivalent of refreshed in a game.

"So, whats the plan?" Jack asked, as you all basked in the warm glow of the campfire.
"Well, I'd like to head out and do some scouting" You said.
"Any particular direction?" Sasha asked.
"North, back to the place where we started."
"Alright, I'll come with" Sasha said.

The rest of the gang had other plans, wanting to improve the living conditions and seeing what else was nearby, so thirty minutes later, you and Sasha bid goodbye and headed north.

"Should be good, just the two of us" Sasha said, her black hair perfectly straight as it went down her back. "We can get some girl time in"
"Girl time?"
"You know, girl stuff... Come on, you must know what I'm talking about."

Considering your entire previous life was actually as a guy, you actually had no idea.
"Not really, no. What do you want to talk about?" You asked. Sasha looked at you weirdly.
"Never mind" She murmured.

The trek through the forest passed uneventfully, dried leaves and twigs cracked beneath your feet. Eventually, you arrived back at the great temple building and headed up the stairs.
As your eyes adjusted to the gloom of the open area, you observed that there was only a small group of about ten to fifteen people off to one side.
"Looks good enough to me" You said, heading over to them. They immediately noticed you and three of them stood up.

"Who are you?" One of them asked, a thuggish looking man who had a slight hunch. He had a sharpened stick in his hand, which your arm device determined to be a measily weapon rating of five.
"Names Athena" You said, putting your hand over your heart "And this is Sasha"
"And what business do you have with the Terenar Guild?"
"Terenar Guild?" You asked in confusion.
"Yea, thats right, you noob. This is a game, right? Games have guilds and we made our own one"

The thought had never occured to you.
"Alright then. I actually came to see if you wanted to trade." You said.
"Pah. You don't have anything with you"
"I'm not going to just walk around with valuables on me and risk losing them." You retorted.
"That armor looks quite good" He said, looking straight at you. Someone behind him unsheathed a small weapon. It was another stick, also sharpened, but it looked like it was more for throwing than anything else. Everyone else in the group stood up to face you.

"I'm not trading my armor" You said firmly.
"I never said I would trade for it" He said quietly.
"Your arm devices let you compare weapon and armor ratings. Why don't you see what I am capable of"
"Already know about that. And I think we can win in numbers"

"You want to take me on?" You asked.
"Count me in" Said Sasha, angrily.
"Not this one" You told Sasha quietly. "This ones mine" Sasha backed away, annoyed at her chance to fight having been removed.

"Fine, we can take her on after we finish with you" Your opponent said.
"Before I smash your face into the ground, might I know your name?" You asked.
"Hood. Call me Hood"
"Alright then... Hood"

Hood charged at you. You brought your arm back and smashed it into his face, sending him flying several meters and bowling over a few of his friends. He quickly got to his feet.
"Well get her!" He yelled at his friends. They looked at you for a second and then charged in, yelling at the top of their lungs.
You prepared yourself for this battle, quickly calculating the most effective way to take them down. Throwing with your left hand, you smashed it into the body of your first assailant and then brought up your legs to quickly kick away the second. The third was the most unlucky, as you picked him up with both hands, spun him around once and then threw him into a group of five more oncoming enemies. Sasha watched with glee.

The next few charged at you in a horozontal line, so you quickly ducked to avoid the first fist punch, kicking your legs out and spinning around to topple them over.
All of your assailants slowly picked themselves up off the ground, unwilling to fight again. Most of them now had extremely low health and it would be pitiful to finish them off. It wasnt an honourable fight.

Hood finally decided to come after you himself, but you just punched him in the gut and he fell to his knees. You stared down at him and grabbed his jaw.
"Know this, Hood. You've just made an enemy of the 'Targe of the Light'. Cross me again, and you won't live" You said angrily. You let go and he spat blood. "Now, I believe that I am entitled to the spoils of victory. Sasha, find something good that they have"

Sasha crossed through the crowd and picked through their belongings. "Nothing much useful here, except for a few scraps. Wait, found this" Sasha said, holding up a Ruby.
"Where did you get this?" You asked Hood.
"Noneovyourbusiness" He said. You kicked him over.

"Come on, lets go" You said to Sasha. She trailed on behind you. "Let's get back to camp.
1113111111221111112111111.title: Next morning...

choices: Join Esmeralda at the ancient statue ruins.
Aid the homeless in the plains...
11131111112211111121111111.content:
The trek back to camp was short and quick, however upon approaching, you noticed three unfamiliar woman inside having a discussion with your friends.

"...to the west and some strange statue to the east. Most of the game seems to be in the north, but these wolf pelts are probably the best thing i've come across so far" Said the centre girl, a tall red head. She was flanked by two other girls, one of which had black hair that was tied up with a pin and the other let her short brown hair hang loose.

"Thanks. It's good to know there's other honourable people out here" Jack said, shaking her hand.
"Oh, don't let us worry you. Everyone needs to work together to get out of here"
"Speaking of coming and going, here's the boss" Simon said, gesturing to you.

"Ah, I was wondering when we would have the honour of meeting such an esteemed woman" The girl said, turning to you. Her eyes sparkled an iridescent green.
"Esteemed? Who have you been talking to?" You joked. Everyone laughed. "Name's Athena"
"I am Esmeralda, and this is Jennifer and Tara"
"Pleasure to meet you. What brings you out here?"
"To be honest, hunting" Esmeralda said. You all sat down around the campfire, Esmeralda directly to your left and Jack opposite you.
"I haven't seen anything but wolves since we first arrived" You said.
"Yes, I was just telling Jack here were most of the animals are. This section of the forest seems to mostly be occupied by wolves, but are a few rabbits and other small animals running about. I think I saw a fox about an hour ago. However, if you are interested in hunting, go north past the temple. There's big game there, both docile and dangerous. Packs of deer run through the forest and there are bears twice the size of people"
"Sounds dangerous"
"Tell that to the first few groups who went into the forest" Tara said, biting her lip. Esmeralda looked at her for a second, her face placid. She sighed.

"You've been lucky out here, so far away from everyone else" Jennifer said.
"How so?" Sasha asked.
"We started travelling right from the beginning. We three know each other from Earth so there was little question in sticking together. Did you fight in the evening war?"
You looked at Jack and Frank, they shook their heads slowly.
"It's what everyone is calling it. The afternoon of being here, everyone started to form into groups, mostly around the strongest looking person. Then the fights broke out over the stronger groups, everyone wanting to claim a metaphorical crown. It wasnt glorious"
"War is war" Sasha said quietly.
"Yea, but this is a game different to any other" Tara said.
"Regardless, alotta people got hurt. In the late evening, everyone kinda split up, suddenly realising that they actually didnt have the health to keep fighting. A large group of people grouped together on the eastern plains, but there's no central leadership. They just sit there around small fires arguing over what to do next"
"Thought as much" You said quietly.
"It's not all bad though. You have this place and there's others who are making a start of something here. We've already made great strides"
"How so?" You asked, looking at the crude leather they wore. Jack threw something at you.
"Look at that" He said, smiling.

You caught the small object in your hand, it was a coil of string.
"You made this?" You asked in surprise.
"Yea, and there's alot more where that came from if you want" Esmeralda said, smiling.
"I'll trade for it"
"Already did a deal with Jack and Simon here. We're taking a few pelts and a bit of meat, but you get the better end of the bargain"
"I did a quick check and we won't be running low on food any time soon" Simon said.
"Alright, but is there anything in particular you want?" You asked, trying to find a way to cement a long trading relationship. Esmeralda stared deeply at you.

"I know you have raw iron" She said slowly. "And I want it... we want it"
"For?" You asked simply.
"Improve our armor. We want to stay light, but a bit of reinforcement can't be bad"

"Everyone, keep our guests entertained. Esmeralda, come with me. I think I can do something better"

-----

You gathered up all the neccecary objects that you needed: Leather, Iron ore, a hammer and a few other small things.
"What are you doing?" Esmeralda asked.
"You'll see"

Working the forge hard, you melted the iron down into thin sheets and studs. Then you created three leather vests and underlayed them with the iron sheets. Lastly, you pushed the iron studs into the leather and let them cool. Then, you presented them to Esmeralda.
"This is beautiful" She said, fitting it to herself.
"The other two are for you friends. I think you may prefer it over your original fittings"
"Thanks Athena. We certainly will. By the way, I want to ask you something"
"Yes?"
"Have you been back to the temple?"
"We were there this morning" You said, leaning on your hammer "Why?"
"So you must have encountered Hood"
"Yes. I beat him and his friends up. It was quite relaxing"
"How many were there?"
"About ten, maybe fifteen"
"Then you were lucky. Hood actually controls a very large group of people, maybe bordering on over a hundred. He's already formed a guild of his own thats fully structured. I won't be surprised if they come knocking on your doors soon"
"Thanks for the warning" You said, surprised by the new information.
"And just one other thing, when me and the girls were scouting, we found some strange statue to the east surrounded by ruins, looks old - ancient actually. Might be worth a look"
"We could always explore tomorrow if we get the time"
"The girls and I are going to explore there tomorrow, if you do come, your welcome to join us"
11131111112211111121111111.title: Another group has arrived at your camp...

choices: Yea, lets go into the arena!
No, lets explore the stands some more...
111311111122111111211111111.content:
Esmeralda and her girls left a short while later, and you noticed the glee on the other two girls faces as they saw your gift of new armor.

Frank had found an apple tree not far away and had picked some for the gang to eat, a welcome alternative to wolf meat.
"So, whats the plan tomorrow?" Jack asked.
"Esmeralda has invited us all to go exploring some ruins" You said. "I'm pretty keen on going and your all welcome to come"
"I will guard our camp then" Frank said. "Ruins do not interest me, but if you find something for my hammer, then I will gladly come at a later"

You decided not to fight Frank over the matter. However, everyone else was keen to come.
"There's one other thing. We need to create our own guild" You said.
"You already have a name though" Sasha said.
"Right. I came up with it on the spot. 'Targe of the Light'... What do you think?"
Jack snorted and Simon and Frank stared at you.
"Comical, but alright" Simon muttered.

You rolled your eyes, annoyed, but used your arm device to invite them all to your new guild. A few blinking lights indicated that they had all agreed to join.

-----

Early next morning, you Sasha, Jack and Simon left camp and headed to the eastern ruins. The forest ended abruptly to some open plains and you saw the ruins not far in the distance.
"There" You said, pointing at them.

Moving at a quick pace, you soon arrived and began to look around. The statue that Esmeralda had mentioned stood motionless in the middle. It was a warrior holding a greatsword with two hands, the weapon right in front of him pointing downwards, as if he was forever contemplating something deep and important.

Esmeralda suddenly jumped down from up high behind you.
"Whoa! You scared me!" You said, suddenly jumping back.
"Ha ha. I knew I would get you" She said, beaming. "So, found anything?"
"We only just arrived" Jack said, kicking away a stone.
"You can get a great view from up there" Esmeralda said, pointing to a high arch.
"I can't get up there" You said flatly.
"Did you try jumping?" Esmeralda asked quizically.
"I can't jump that high" You retorted. "That's three meters higher than anyone can jump."

Esmeralda stared at you. "What level are you?" She asked.
"What?" You replied.
"What. Level?"

Esmeralda came over and grabbed your wrist device. "You do know you can assign points at every level up to improve yourself, right?"
"No"
She rolled her eyes and showed you the relevant screen on your arm device. "Whoa! You have FIFTY unspent points?" She cried out in surprise.
"Is that alot?"
"I'm only level 6 and you only get two per level, giving me a total of twelve! Your already level 25!"
"Well, I did go and beat up all of Hood's friends yesterday... and we raided a mine..."
"Your good" Esmeralda said.
"Gimmie a second to work this out" You told her. She proceeded to show the rest of your group what to do. You really did not know about all this, as you wanted everything in the game to be a surprise. Four spendable slots were available: Health Increase, Stamina Increase, Stength Increase and Agility Increase. Intelligence was based on the actual player.

You decided to go with being a well balanced person, assigning ten points to all four options and then five more to Health Increase and Stamina Increase.
"Alright, try jumping" Esmeralda said.
You took a running jump and suddenly found yourself sailing right over the arch that Esmeralda had pointed out before. You managed to land perfectly on your feet, the expected groundshock never appearing.
"This is amazing!" You said.
"Just remember to check when you level up" Esmeralda said. "It can be very helpful. There's also another panel for weapon upgrades, but you can look at that later"
"Sure"

Your guild and Esmeralda's girls proceeded to look around the ruins, hoping to find something interesting - some sort of access to a dungeon. Indeed, your connection to the website definately indicated a very large dungeon beneath the ruins but you stopped yourself from figuring out how to get inside.
"Found anything?" Tara finally asked about an hour later.
"Nope" You said, sitting down. Sasha jumped up to sit on the hilt of the statues sword. She had placed her few points mostly into stamina and agility upgrades, hoping to become a prominent archer. Suddenly, the sword shifted and she jumped off in shock.
"What did you do?" You asked.
"Nothing! I just sat on it!"

The sword shifted again, sinking into the ground a few centimeters.
All of a sudden, a door suddenly opened up beneath the statue, allowing access down into a deep, black stairway.
"Ready?" Esmeralda asked, a grin on her face. She ignited a stick with a rag around it and proceeded down into hallway. You and your guild followed on.
The small hallway soon opened up into a chamber, what looked like some sort of underground gatehouse.
"This is eerily empty" Jennifer said, standing closer to Tara. Esmeralda found a few lampposts and lit them.

The chamber slowly began to light up more and more. It was fairly ruined, with a nearly completely collapsed ceiling in one corner.
"Fun" You said. "Nothing much here, lets keep going"
You all proceeded further on, coming to a crossroad.
"Which way?" You asked. Esmeralda found another torch in a scone and lit it. Each diverging path had a label above it.
"Here, this one apparently leads to a grand hall" Tara said, pointing to the one on the far left.
"This one's a colliseum of some sort" Jack said, pointing to the centre.
"And this one unmarked" Sasha said. "Oh goody goody"

"I like the idea of not knowing whats ahead. Makes it a fun challenge" Esmeralda said, grinning. So you all proceeded down the unmarked path. Fairly soon, the carved walls gave way to a large cave, a small waterfall in the far corner with light streaming in from the surface.
"Nothing here" You said dissappointed.

You all headed back to the crossroads and decided to head to the colliseum. It was a far shorter walk and suddenly you were greeted with the sight of a massive underground arena.
"This, this is cool" Esmeralda said. You all walked down the steps as Esmeralda lit several torches in scones.
"Whoa, big" You said, coming to the edge of the spectator stands and looking down into the large pit. It was about a meter down from where you stood and was half the size of a cricket pitch.
"Should we go down?" Simon asked.
111311111122111111211111111.title: Join Esmeralda at the ancient statue ruins.

choices: Sakiro is defeated! Hood retreats to the shadows again...
Sakiro still isnt defeated! Hood isnt ready to back down yet...
1113111111221111112111111111.content:
"Sure, why not?" You said. Esmeralda looked at you with mild concern.
"It could be a trap" She said.
"What could make it more fun?" You grinned, hopping over the railing and landing in the soft dirt. Everyone else followed behind you shortly as you walked to the centre.
"Now this, this is awesome" You said, still grinning.

"We could have all sorts of fun down here" Simon said. "Imagine what some of the games duels would be like"
"Duels?" Tara asked.
"Yea, you didn't know? This game lets us engage in duels. It's like a semi-safe way of fighting another player. The only difference to an ordinary fight is that rather than losing all your health and dying, you lose all your health and lose the match" Simon said.
"How'd you know that?" You asked Simon with surprise.
"Had a match with Frank... Something that I will not repeat again" He said, shrugging his shoulders.

"Well, I'm sure we can setup some sort of system to claim this place" Esmeralda said. "It'd be a shame to let it go to waste. Besides, I'm sure we can profit off it somehow!" She laughed.

Suddenly, a large number of lights blinked on above you.
"I'm glad you like it!" Called out an all too familiar voice from behind you. Perched on the edge of the arena wall, looking down at you was Hood. He must have followed you in here.
Suddenly, a large number of people appeared from hidden spots. You looked around with a blank look on your face. At least three hundred must have gathered here, waiting for you to arrive. Hood was counting on your curiosity. All of them were armed with a variety of weak weapons, but it was becoming clear that everyone, or at least Hood's guild, were learning how to survive, and craft.

Hood jumped down onto the arena floor and walked up to you. If he and his guild was about to challenge you, that wouldnt be good. Sure, you'd be fine, but there was minimal chance that anyone else in your group would survive. No, this would be a one on one match.
"Welcome to my little pad" Hood said with an evil grin on his face. "I hope your ready to fight for your survival"
"A man of dishonour, fighting three hundred to seven? How about we even things up a bit" You said flatly. "One on one"

Hood pouted.
"Two on Two" He said firmly. "Can't have you cheating again, can we?"
"Alright"
"Hey! You can't decide for us!" Sasha groaned.
"Relax. Just join in the match and I'll take care of these clowns" You said sweetly. Sasha folded her arms, annoyed and then pressed accept on her arm device.

"Sakiro! Time for a warm up!" Hood yelled up into the crowd. Almost instantly, a figure jumped from the crowd and landed perfectly beside Hood. Whoever she was, she had very quickly become attuned to the game.
"Hello Sweetie" She said, licking her lips as she pushed back a lock of red hair. You reeled in disgust. So did Sasha.
"Remember what I said" You whispered to Sasha. She nodded and stood her ground. You stepped forward between her and your opposers"
"One at a time? We can do that" Sakiro said.
"You first" You said calmly, curious as to her fighting style.

Hood looked at her for a second and she suddenly started running towards you at an incredible speed. Yet she held no weapon, which you were initially surprised at. Although, at the last minute you managed to raise your sword to block two daggers which she produced from her side. They were black, perfectly masked against the dimly lit arena.
Sakiro started hitting again and again with vicious haste. Fortunately though, your own natural ability meant that she couldnt land a single hit. Something that you observed must have annoyed her greatly as she increased her speed.

To her own surprise, you brought up your shield now to assist in blocking, now able to use your sword to help push her back. Moreso, you surprised her by taking advantage of a split second gap in defenses by bashing your shield to her face.
Sakiro staggered back, bewildered. Hood looked on in annoyance while Esmeralda suppressed a light laugh.

Sakiro came back towards you, completely changing her strategy and trying to hit you from all sides. This time, Hood joined in, producing a large angular blade that you didn't know he had owned. Perhaps he had stolen it.
Either way, they were both constantly on opposite sides of you, making defense slightly difficult as you constantly switched the sides of your sword and shield.
Another break in Sakiro's defense meant that you could hit her again, except this time you sent her flying with your sword. Hood tried to take advantage of your sword being busy and tried to stab you in the back. Unfortunately for him though, your shield had come around as well, making a clean hit on his face. This also sent him flying, almost as far as Sakiro.
1113111111221111112111111111.title: Yea, lets go into the arena!

choices: You have guests at the campfire...
Finish up for the day with some sparring training...
11131111112211111121111111111.content:
Sakiro stood up slowly, stumbling backwards a few steps. She wiped a trace of blood away from her mouth and looked up at you.

The game clearly identified you as the winner, your Arm Device lighting up green and displaying the word "Victory!", as well as the relevant exp that you had gained. You hadnt really noticed this before in previous battles, but then again, you weren't really looking for it either.
Hood now stood up beside Sakiro, seething in defeat.

Curious, you looked through the map data of your arm device. Apparently this arena was open to player versus player combat, making it rather dangerous for your party. Hood must have known, as he then shouted an order to his guild.
"She's weakened! Take her down!" He yelled.
You had no idea where Hood got the idea that you had been weakened. They had barely laid a scratch on you and your healthbar clearly indicated 99% health. Regardless, Hood was trying the same strategy as before, defeating you with numbers. Except, this time he actually had a chance, since all your foes now actually had reasonable weapons and armor.

"Form a tight group!" You told your friends. "I'm going to try something new"

Everyone looked at you in dispair. Despite your power, could you really hold off all these people? Now was the time to find out.
Your foes began to drop down into the arena, charging at you with their swords, maces and spears held high. Just before they hit you, you raised your sword high and plunged it into the ground.

Everyone was surprised when they saw the blue light suddenly eminate from your blade, forming multiple cracks along the ground. Suddenly, the light from your sword glowed brighter and then exploded outward, hitting everyone charging towards you. The impact sent them all flying. When they hit the ground hard, they stayed down, stunned from the massive attack.

You felt the drain on yourself as you lowered to your knee, suddenly overcome with exhaustion. That attack was extremely difficult and costly to you.
"We need to leave" You said, lifting your sword with one hand and clutching your chest with your other.
"What the hell was that?" Sasha asked.
"I'll explain once we get somewhere safe" You said. "We need to ge-"
However, before you could finish, you fainted and fell to the ground.

-----

"-blue light of sorts, just came out of her sword"
"Hit everyone and sent them flying"
"I don't believe it"
"I don't expect you to, but thats what she did and she saved us"
"Well, it's good that you are all okay"

You suddenly sat up, aware of the voices around you. Once your vision finally came into focus, you discovered that you were back at your own little fort in the forest.
"Ah, your awake" Sasha said, coming over to you with a damp rag. She pressed it against your forehead. "You've been out for a number of hours. Esmeralda and Jennifer took turns carrying you back here"
"Thanks... What happened?"
"You knocked out everyone attacking us"
"Yea, I know that... I mean after"
"Well, they were still out cold when you stunned them. Must have not been ready for something like that... What the heck WAS that anyway?" Simon said, leaning on a chair in the corner.
"There's powers... or 'abilities' in this game. You all might want to check up on that later" You said. "Anyway, I found an interesting one that was actually only designed to eminate out a few meters"
"That wasnt a few"
"Oh, you can push abilities, but I think I now know why you shouldnt"

Sasha rolled her eyes and took the rag away.
"Well, at least your alright." She said.
"What happened to Esmeralda and her girls?" You asked.
"Been and gone, out hunting some more. You've really made an impression on her"
"Good one?"
"Definately... I suspect a few people around here might be looking at you like a sort of leader"
11131111112211111121111111111.title: Sakiro is defeated! Hood retreats to the shadow...

choices: Hood doesnt want it done and launches a surprise attack...
111311111122111111211111111111.content:
"Oh, and when your ready" Sasha said, "There's some people around the campfire waiting for you"
"Hmm?" You muttered.
"Some people from the mass group camped out on the plains. Looks like they really want to talk"
"Oh great... what did I do"
"I dunno" Sasha said, shrugging her shoulders. "But it looks like they've come a fair distance"
"Alright, lets go"

You headed outside to meet your guests and sat down at the campfire.
"Hey. I'm Athena. Apparently you've been expecting me"
"Indeed" A largish man said. Frank watched from the corner, almost distrustful of the newcomers. "My name is Jacob and we've a fair bit about you over the last few days"
"From who?" You asked.
"Various people travelling throughout the region. Apparently you've really set off the spark with Hood"
"Sasha... How long was I out?" You asked, turning to her.
"Three days"
"THREE DAYS?" You yelled. She stifled a laugh.
"Relax... We've done a bit of trading, made a slight profit and overall, done alright"

You turned back to your guests, shaking your head. "So, what can I do for you?"
"We've learned a bit about how this... 'game' works. And we want to form an alliance"
"Alliance?"
"Yes. Your guild is apparently called the Targe of the Light and we want to form an alliance with our haphazard guild: The plain walkers"
"I'm certainly interested. But whats in it for us?" You asked.
"Have you learned about the inventory system yet?" Jacob asked.
"A bit"

You chalk it up to the aftereffects of some weird dreams. You shake your head. As if there was a website that could bend reality to your whim. You chuckle to yourself, but it dies as soon as it started when you see the tickets still propped up against your computer’s screen. You can see that they are for the best seats in the house, as you had wished for in your dream, but it hadn’t been a dream. And if that wasn’t a dream…

You tear your gaze away from the tickets – though a part of your mind also notes that the message on the screen now states that the changes have been completed – and look down at yourself. Mary buttons the coat closed to disguise your near nudity, as she shepherds you out the door. The copper-haired maid hails a taxi with a surprisingly loud whistle. In moments, taxi stops. Pulling back on the reins the horse slows and Mary hands him the payment, and his instructions.

The width barely enough for a husband and wife, or a business man alone, the thought of two broad rumped women travelling together clearly not entering the designer's thoughts.

As the hansom pulls into Harley street, you feel the pace slow, until the carriage stops with a whinny, and Mary frees herself from the seat. Taking your hand, you allow yourself to be lead into the Doctor's waiting room.

Frankly, you're glad to be away from your husband, and his hands. The waiting room is empty, and so Mary pulls the cord to summon attention.

Mary sits beside you, part consort, part body-guard. Her task to wait upon you, but also ensure the Master's will is obeyed.

And yet... you wish it was real. Almost of its own volition, your mouse clicks on your address bar and you find yourself typing in the address in the email. You don't trust it not to be a scam, but it couldn't hurt to check out the web site, could it?

When your browser finishes loading the page, you find yourself staring at a rather normal looking web page. Then your eyes see a button in the corner of the page: Got our Email? Don't know if it's real? Click here.

You click the button, and the second you do, the doorbell rings. You get up out of your chair and walk to the front door, opening it to find a handsome man, dressed in a business suit and tie, standing on your doorstep.

"Ms. Teresa Williams?" He asks, his voice smooth as honey.

You nod.

"I'm here from Reality-Shift-dot-Net. It seems you got our email and were unsure if it was real or not, so you pressed the test button on our website." He reaches into his suit-coat and removes an envelope. "I'm here to give you one thousand dollars."

He hands you the envelope and then disappears. Not runs off. Not hops in a car and zooms away. No, right in front of your eyes he just simply ceases to exist.

You look down at the envelope in your hand. You can't believe it. You look inside and find ten crisp hundred dollar bills. This can't be happening. And yet deep inside of you, a little voice tells you that it is.

It's no secret that you're not exactly satisfied with your life. Sure, it seemed to have started out well. You married your highschool sweetheart right after graduation, had three beautiful babies, and were seeming to live the American Dream. But deep down, your life is as far from perfect as you can get. Your husband, once the most desirable boy in highschool, has turned into an insufferable jerk. Yet as much as you want to, you can't leave him because you rely on his income to pay the bills. You don't have any qualifications for getting a job on your own, because you decided to stay home and have his kids instead of going to college. Your children, once the pride of your life, now seem to take pleasure in disappointing you at every opportunity. Your once beautiful body has melted down into the chubby form of the average middle American housewife. Your days, that at one time you hoped would be filled with adventure and excitement, now consist of cleaning house, washing dishes, and hours upon hours of surfing the internet, hoping to find something that can take your mind off of how pathetic your life has become.

So if this website's offer is true... could this really be your chance to change your fate? You rush back to the computer, finding it still on the website. Quickly re-reading the email you got to remember your user name and password, your log in ready to start.

What you see overwhelms you. Option upon option, line upon line of things you can change. You just don't know where to start. Then, a little pop-up appears. New to our site? Overwhelmed by all the options? For simple mode, click here

You click there, and the page seems to rearrange itself for you. Now, it's much easier to understand.

- Want to change something about a specific person? Click here.
- Want to change something in the past? Click here
- Want to change the world? Click here
- Want to change all of reality? Click here
- Want to change something else but don't see it here? Click here for all of our other options.

14113.content:
"Of course, Master, you just have to wish it."

This was so odd a statement that Jeff -- after minimizing his web browser window, just in case -- walked down the hall of the three-bedroom house.

There, in the house's cramped kitchen, in the middle of making dinner, was his mother. However, she wore a genie costume -- a very fancy-looking one, no less; her hair was in a ponytail and she wore diaphanous baggy pants, a sequin-bedecked top that was little more than a push-up bra, a fair amount of gold jewels, and even a pair of slippers with long toes that curled up.

Jeff then realized she looked at least 20 years younger than she was "supposed" to look -- maybe only in her early 20s.

"Mom?" he asked.

"Yes, Master?" she responded.

"Uhh, so it's okay if we have cake for dinner?"

She smiled. "Of course, Master. Whatever you wish."

"But you're already making dinner," he pointed out.

"I will do whatever you prefer," she assured him.

More to see what would happen than because he actually wanted cake, Jeff said, "Okay, I wish we were having chocolate cake for dinner, nothing else."

His mother crossed her arms over her chest and nodded her head, a gesture Jeff had seen in countless reruns of "I Dream of Jeannie."

The pans disappeared from the stove, the kitchen now sparkling clean, with no evidence that it was in use seconds ago -- even the smell of the cooking food was gone. Jeff turned to see a giant chocolate cake sitting in the middle of the rickety dining room table, with three place settings of only a small plate and dessert fork. Stunned, he just stared.

At that moment, a car pulled into the driveway.

"Oh, good timing -- Mistress is home," said Jeff's genie mother.

"Mistress," Jeff whispered to himself. His 18-year-old sister Stephanie. He suddenly wondered if the reality-changing nature of the website meant that he'd be meeting a version of his sister who had grown up with a genie for a mother. He braced himself as the front door opened.

Suddenly Jeff became very self aware. What the hell was he doing? This isn't right, going through someone's private stuff like this. Could he allow this from himself? No, never. He was just a normal, healthy, teenager. This meant that he had a healthy sex drive too, but still, he wasn't some pervert going through the private conversations of girls he hardly knew.

He logged out of Chloe's account, and back in as himself. Looking through the activity of his friends, he saw that nothing had changed. Still the same people, posting the same stuff. Although he never really was that interested, seeing the pictures of his friends at first distracted him from his worries, but when he got to pictures of himself, he started thinking. This guy, the person he saw in the pictures, now he was someone else. He wasn't able to trust him any longer, so much had already been proven. Exactly who Jeff was, he couldn't tell, but it became painfully obvious that he and himself now weren't the same person.

He felt weaker than the person in the pictures, not because he had turned into a girl, but because that person had broken him. That person had given him this miserable existence, if anything close to a god existed, it had to be him. Now, because of a single act of power from this Jeff, he had to be someone he couldn't be, and he was even losing the last link with his old life that he had. The feeling that he was who he was, was gone. He couldn't be Chloe, and looking at the pictures, he quickly saw that he couldn't be Jeff either.

So what he did, was stand up, and first making sure he could keep his balance, he made his way to the huge mirror on the other end of the room. After a couple of hours of being in this body, walking wasn't that much of a problem. He still had to do it slowly, carefully placing one foot after the other, he knew however that after a little bit of practice, no one would notice anything strange in his movement.

He wanted to take a look at Chloe, a real good look. Standing close to the mirror, while simultaneously making sure he wasn't falling over, he tried to introduce himself to the quite sad looking girl in the mirror. She was pretty, real pretty. With long brown hair that, although obviously unkempt, still laid gently over her shoulders. Her eyes large, with a look in them emanating real emotion in a way that boys only get to see when they are truly loved by someone, and then only at their most intimate moments together. You could see she had been crying, Jeff hadn't realised this before now. In a friendly gesture, he tried to cheer her up, and she smiled back to him.

"I am Chloe," she said, still smiling at him "what's your name?"

"I am Chloe," she repeated, "nice to meet you."

A giggle emerged from her sweet mouth, an innocent, girly sound, coming from someone who had no trouble knowing who she was. Her eyes beamed up, as if all that she had been worrying about now seemed but a trifle.
